show.title: Star Trek: The Original Series
show.description: In the 23rd Century, Captain James T. Kirk and the crew of the U.S.S. Enterprise explore the galaxy and defend the United Federation of Planets.

episodes.title: The Cage
episodes.description: Capt. Pike is held prisoner and tested by aliens who have the power to project incredibly lifelike illusions.

episodes.title: The Man Trap
episodes.description: Dr. McCoy discovers his old flame is not what she seems after crew members begin dying from a sudden lack of salt in their bodies.

episodes.title: Charlie X
episodes.description: Captain Kirk must learn the limits to the power of a 17-year-old boy with the psionic ability to create anything and destroy anyone.

episodes.title: Where No Man Has Gone Before
episodes.description: The flight recorder of the 200-year-old U.S.S. Valiant relays a tale of terror--a magnetic storm at the edge of the galaxy.

episodes.title: The Naked Time
episodes.description: The crew is infected with a mysterious disease that removes people's emotional inhibitions to a dangerous degree.

episodes.title: The Enemy Within
episodes.description: A transporter malfunction splits Captain Kirk into two halves: one meek and indecisive, the other violent and ill tempered. The remaining crew members stranded on the planet cannot be beamed up to the ship until a problem is fixed.

episodes.title: Mudd's Women
episodes.description: The Enterprise picks up untrustworthy entrepreneur Harry Mudd accompanied by three beautiful women who immediately put a spell on all the male crew members.

episodes.title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
episodes.description: Nurse Chapel is reunited with her fiancé; but his new obsession leads him to make an android duplicate of Captain Kirk.

episodes.title: Miri
episodes.description: The Enterprise discovers a planet exactly like Earth, but the only inhabitants are children who contract a fatal disease upon entering puberty.

episodes.title: Dagger of the Mind
episodes.description: Kirk and psychiatrist Helen Noel are trapped on a maximum security penal colony that experiments with mind control and Spock must use the Vulcan mind-meld to find a way to save them.

episodes.title: The Corbomite Maneuver
episodes.description: After the Enterprise is forced to destroy a dangerous marker buoy, a gigantic alien ship arrives to capture and condemn the crew as trespassers.

episodes.title: The Menagerie: Part I
episodes.description: Spock kidnaps the disabled Capt. Pike, hijacks the Enterprise, and then surrenders for court martial.

episodes.title: The Menagerie: Part II
episodes.description: At Spock's court martial, he explains himself with mysterious footage about when Capt. Pike was kidnapped by powerful illusion casting aliens.

episodes.title: The Conscience of the King
episodes.description: While Captain Kirk investigates whether an actor is actually a presumed dead mass murderer, a mysterious assailant is killing the people who could identify the fugitive.

episodes.title: Balance of Terror
episodes.description: The Enterprise must decide on its response when a Romulan ship makes a destructively hostile armed probe of Federation territory.

episodes.title: Shore Leave
episodes.description: The past months have left the crew exhausted and in desperate need of a break, but does this explain McCoy's encounter with a human-sized white rabbit or Kirk crossing paths with the prankster who plagued his days at Starfleet Academy?

episodes.title: The Galileo Seven
episodes.description: The Galileo, under Spock's command, crash-lands on a hostile planet. As the Enterprise races against time to find the shuttlecraft, Spock's strictly logical leadership clashes with the fear and resentment of his crew.

episodes.title: The Squire of Gothos
episodes.description: A being that controls matter and creates planets wants to play with the Enterprise crew.

episodes.title: Arena
episodes.description: For bringing hostility into their solar system, a superior alien race brings Captain Kirk into mortal combat against the reptilian captain of an alien ship he was pursuing.

episodes.title: Tomorrow Is Yesterday
episodes.description: The Enterprise is thrown back in time to 1960s Earth.

episodes.title: Court Martial
episodes.description: Kirk draws a court martial in the negligent death of a crewman.

episodes.title: The Return of the Archons
episodes.description: Seeking the answer to a century-old mystery, Kirk and crew encounter a vacantly peaceful society under a 6000-year autocratic rule that kills all those it can't absorb.

episodes.title: Space Seed
episodes.description: While on patrol in deep space, Captain Kirk and his crew find and revive a genetically-engineered world conqueror and his compatriots from Earth's Twentieth Century.

episodes.title: A Taste of Armageddon
episodes.description: Kirk and Spock must save their ship's crew when they are all declared killed in action in a bizarre computer simulated war where the actual deaths must nevertheless occur.

episodes.title: This Side of Paradise
episodes.description: The Enterprise investigates a planet whose colonists should be dead, but are not.

episodes.title: The Devil in the Dark
episodes.description: The Enterprise is sent to a mining colony that is being terrorized by a mysterious monster, only to find that the situation is not that simple.

episodes.title: Errand of Mercy
episodes.description: With a war with Klingons raging, Kirk and Spock attempt to resist an occupation of a planet with incomprehensibly placid natives.

episodes.title: The Alternative Factor
episodes.description: Existence itself comes under threat from a man's power-struggle with his alternate self, with the Enterprise's strained dilithium crystals presenting his key to a final solution.

episodes.title: The City on the Edge of Forever
episodes.description: When a temporarily insane Dr. McCoy accidentally changes history and destroys his time, Kirk and Spock follow him to prevent the disaster, but the price to do so is high.

episodes.title: Operation -- Annihilate!
episodes.description: The Enterprise crew attempts to stop a plague of amoeba-like creatures from possessing human hosts and spreading throughout the galaxy.

episodes.title: Amok Time
episodes.description: In the throes of his Pon Farr mating period, Spock must return to Vulcan to meet his intended future wife, betrothed from childhood.

episodes.title: Who Mourns for Adonais?
episodes.description: A powerful being claiming to be the Greek god Apollo appears and demands that the crew of the Enterprise disembark onto his planet to worship him.

episodes.title: The Changeling
episodes.description: A powerful artificially intelligent Earth probe, with a murderously twisted imperative, comes aboard the Enterprise and mistakes Capt. Kirk for its creator.

episodes.title: Mirror, Mirror
episodes.description: A transporter accident places Captain Kirk's landing party in an alternate universe, where the Enterprise is in the service of a barbarically brutal empire.

episodes.title: The Apple
episodes.description: Primitive inhabitants of Gamma Trianguli VI worship a god who orders them to kill visitors from the Enterprise.

episodes.title: The Doomsday Machine
episodes.description: The USS Enterprise encounters the wrecked USS Constellation and its distraught commodore who's determined to stop the giant planet-destroying robot ship that killed his crew.

episodes.title: Catspaw
episodes.description: Very alien visitors to our galaxy attempt to connect with human consciousness but miss, winding up tapping into the regions of human nightmares instead.

episodes.title: I, Mudd
episodes.description: Harry Mudd returns with a plot to take over the Enterprise by stranding the crew on a planet populated by androids under his command.

episodes.title: Metamorphosis
episodes.description: While returning to the Enterprise aboard the shuttlecraft, Kirk, Spock, McCoy and a seriously ill Federation diplomat find themselves kidnapped by an energized cloud.

episodes.title: Journey to Babel
episodes.description: The Enterprise hosts a number of quarrelling diplomats, including Spock's father, but someone on board has murder in mind.

episodes.title: Friday's Child
episodes.description: The Federation clashes with the Klingon Empire over mining rights to Capella IV. A sudden coup between its warrior-minded inhabitants forces Kirk's party to flee with the now dead leader's pregnant wife.

episodes.title: The Deadly Years
episodes.description: A landing party from the Enterprise is exposed to strange form of radiation which rapidly ages them.

episodes.title: Obsession
episodes.description: Capt. Kirk obsessively hunts for a mysterious cloud creature he encountered in his youth.

episodes.title: Wolf in the Fold
episodes.description: Kirk and the Enterprise computer become detectives after Scotty is accused of murdering women on a pleasure planet.

episodes.title: The Trouble with Tribbles
episodes.description: To protect a space station with a vital grain shipment, Kirk and the crew must deal with Federation bureaucrats, a Klingon battle cruiser and a peddler who sells furry, purring, voracious little creatures as pets.

episodes.title: The Gamesters of Triskelion
episodes.description: Kirk, Uhura and Chekov are trapped on a planet where abducted aliens are enslaved and trained to perform as gladiators for the amusement of bored, faceless aliens.

episodes.title: A Piece of the Action
episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise struggles to cope with a planet of imitative people who have modeled their society on 1920s gangsters.

episodes.title: The Immunity Syndrome
episodes.description: The Enterprise encounters a gigantic energy draining space organism that threatens the galaxy.

episodes.title: A Private Little War
episodes.description: Peaceful, primitive peoples get caught up in the struggle between superpowers, with Kirk unhappily trying to restore the balance of power disrupted by the Klingons.

episodes.title: Return to Tomorrow
episodes.description: The Enterprise is guided to a distant, long-dead world where survivors of an extremely ancient race - existing only as disembodied energy - desiring the bodies of Kirk, Spock and astro-biologist Ann Mulhall so that they may live again.

episodes.title: Patterns of Force
episodes.description: Looking for a missing Federation cultural observer, Kirk and Spock find themselves on a planet whose culture has been completely patterned after Nazi Germany.

episodes.title: By Any Other Name
episodes.description: Galactic alien scouts hijack the Enterprise for a return voyage to their home galaxy and a prelude to invasion. Kirk's only advantage is that they're not fully adapted to the human form they've taken on.

episodes.title: The Omega Glory
episodes.description: Responding to a distress signal, Kirk finds Captain Tracey of the U.S.S. Exeter violating the prime directive and interfering with a war between the Yangs and the Kohms to find the secret of their longevity.

episodes.title: The Ultimate Computer
episodes.description: Kirk and a sub-skeleton crew are ordered to test out an advanced artificially intelligent control system - the M-5 Multitronic system, which could potentially render them all redundant.

episodes.title: Bread and Circuses
episodes.description: The Enterprise crew investigates the disappearance of a ship's crew on a planet that is a modern version of the Roman Empire.

episodes.title: Assignment: Earth
episodes.description: While back in time observing Earth in 1968, the Enterprise crew encounters the mysterious Gary Seven who has his own agenda on the planet.

episodes.title: Spock's Brain
episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise pursues a mysterious woman who has abducted Spock's brain.

episodes.title: The Enterprise Incident
episodes.description: An apparently insane Capt. Kirk has the Enterprise deliberately enter the Romulan Neutral Zone where the ship is immediately captured by the enemy.

episodes.title: The Paradise Syndrome
episodes.description: Trapped on a planet whose inhabitants are descended from Northwestern Native Americans, Kirk loses his memory and is proclaimed a God while the crippled Enterprise races back to the planet before it is destroyed by an asteroid.

episodes.title: And the Children Shall Lead
episodes.description: The Enterprise reaches a Federation colony where the adults have all killed themselves but the children play without care.

episodes.title: Is There in Truth No Beauty?
episodes.description: Lovely telepath Miranda is aide to Ambassador Kollos, in a box to stop insanity when humans see Medusans. She rejects Larry, a designer of Enterprise, and senses murderous intent nearby.

episodes.title: Spectre of the Gun
episodes.description: As punishment for ignoring their warning and trespassing on their planet, the Melkot condemn Capt. Kirk and his landing party to the losing side of a surreal recreation of the 1881 historic gunfight at the OK Corral.

episodes.title: Day of the Dove
episodes.description: Both humans and Klingons have been lured to a planet by a formless entity that feeds on hatred and has set about to fashion them into a permanent food supply for itself.

episodes.title: For the World Is Hollow and I Have Touched the Sky
episodes.description: The Enterprise discovers an apparent asteroid that is on a collision course with a planet is actually an ancient populated generation ship.

episodes.title: The Tholian Web
episodes.description: With Capt. Kirk and the derelict USS Defiant apparently lost, the Enterprise grapples with an insanity causing plague and an attack by the Tholians.

episodes.title: Plato's Stepchildren
episodes.description: After Dr. McCoy helps the leader of a planet populated by people with powerful psionic abilities, they decide to force him to stay by torturing his comrades until he submits.

episodes.title: Wink of an Eye
episodes.description: A group of aliens who exist in a state of incredible acceleration invade the Enterprise and abduct Capt. Kirk.

episodes.title: The Empath
episodes.description: Trapped in an alien laboratory, Kirk, Spock and McCoy meet an empath and are involved in a series of experiments.

episodes.title: Elaan of Troyius
episodes.description: While transporting an arrogant, demanding princess for a political marriage, Captain Kirk must cope both with her biochemical ability to force him to love her, as well as sabotage on his ship.

episodes.title: Whom Gods Destroy
episodes.description: Kirk and Spock are taken prisoners by a former starship captain named Garth, who now resides at, and has taken over, a high security asylum for the criminally insane.

episodes.title: Let That Be Your Last Battlefield
episodes.description: The Enterprise encounters two duo-chromatic and mutually belligerent aliens who put the ship in the middle of their old conflict.

episodes.title: The Mark of Gideon
episodes.description: Kirk beams down to the planet Gideon and appears to find himself trapped on a deserted Enterprise. Spock on the real Enterprise must use his diplomatic skills to deal with the uncooperative inhabitants of Gideon and find the Captain.

episodes.title: That Which Survives
episodes.description: After the Enterprise landing party beams down to investigate a geologically interesting planet, their ship is hurled across the galaxy. Kirk and company find a deserted outpost guarded by the deadly image of a beautiful woman.

episodes.title: The Lights of Zetar
episodes.description: A mysterious, twinkling mass of sapient energy ravages an important archive and Scotty's new girlfriend may be linked to it.

episodes.title: Requiem for Methuselah
episodes.description: On a planet, looking for an urgent medicinal cure, Kirk, Spock and McCoy come across a dignified recluse living privately but in splendor with his sheltered ward and a very protective robot servant.

episodes.title: The Way to Eden
episodes.description: A group of idealistic hippies, led by an irrational leader, come aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise.

episodes.title: The Cloud Minders
episodes.description: Kirk and Spock are caught up in a revolution on a planet where intellectuals and artists live on a utopian city in the sky while the rest of the population toils in mines on the barren surface below.

episodes.title: The Savage Curtain
episodes.description: Kirk, Spock, Abraham Lincoln and Vulcan legend Surak are pitted in battle against notorious villains from history for the purpose of helping a conscious rock creature's understanding of a concept he does not understand, "good vs. evil".

episodes.title: All Our Yesterdays
episodes.description: When Kirk, Spock and McCoy investigate the disappearance of a doomed planet's population, they find themselves trapped in different periods of that world's past.

episodes.title: Turnabout Intruder
episodes.description: Captain Kirk's insane ex-lover Dr. Janice Lester forcibly switches bodies with him in order to take command of the Enterprise.

show.title: Star Trek: The Animated Series
show.description: The further adventures of Captain James T. Kirk and the crew of the USS Enterprise, as they explore the galaxy and defend the United Federation of Planets.

episodes.title: Beyond the Farthest Star
episodes.description: The Enterprise finds an ancient abandoned starship with a malevolent entity aboard, eager to take over the Starfleet ship.

episodes.title: Yesteryear
episodes.description: After finding himself erased from recent history, Spock must travel back in time to save himself as a youth.

episodes.title: One of Our Planets Is Missing
episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise must stop a living planet-consuming cloud before it attacks an inhabited world.

episodes.title: The Lorelei Signal
episodes.description: Female crew members must take over the Enterprise when the men are incapacitated by a race of sirens.

episodes.title: More Tribbles, More Troubles
episodes.description: Cyrano Jones returns, infesting the Enterprise with tribbles that now grow to monstrous size.

episodes.title: The Survivor
episodes.description: A famous humanitarian is found alive near the Romulan Neutral Zone after being missing for five years, but he may not be who he claims to be.

episodes.title: The Infinite Vulcan
episodes.description: On a planet of intelligent plantlike creatures, the clone of a human scientist clones Mr. Spock for use in a galactic peace mission.

episodes.title: The Magicks of Megas-Tu
episodes.description: At the centre of the galaxy, a race puts the Enterprise crew on trial for past grievances.

episodes.title: Once Upon a Planet
episodes.description: Upon returning to the amusement park planet, the Enterprise crew finds the computer, which generates the planet's sophisticated robots, running amok, with the caretaker nowhere to be found.

episodes.title: Mudd's Passion
episodes.description: The Enterprise crew once again runs afoul of the incorrigible Harry Mudd, this time hawking a love potion that greatly influences Spock and the crew.

episodes.title: The Terratin Incident
episodes.description: Exposed to spiroid epsilon waves, the Enterprise crew begins to shrink in size. If a way can not be found to stop their condition, they will soon be too small to control the ship.

episodes.title: The Time Trap
episodes.description: The Enterprise and a Klingon ship are trapped in space-time warp where only their cooperation will allow them to escape.

episodes.title: The Ambergris Element
episodes.description: While the Enterprise investigates a water-world, Captain Kirk and Commander Spock go missing. They've been abducted by the world's inhabitants and altered into water-breathers as well.

episodes.title: The Slaver Weapon
episodes.description: Spock, Uhura and Sulu discover an ancient multi-use weapon and are captured by the Kzinti who are equally interested in it.

episodes.title: The Eye of the Beholder
episodes.description: While investigating the disappearance of Federation members, Kirk and his landing party find themselves placed in an alien zoo.

episodes.title: The Jihad
episodes.description: A team comprising various experts (Kirk and Spock among them) must recover an artifact known as the Soul of the Skorr. The theft must be kept secret or a galactic holy war could break out.

episodes.title: The Pirates of Orion
episodes.description: Spock contracts a fatal disease, and the medicine required for his cure is stolen by Orion pirates.

episodes.title: Bem
episodes.description: The Enterprise crew is being observed to evaluate their suitability to meet with advanced civilizations.

episodes.title: The Practical Joker
episodes.description: The computer of the Enterprise gains partial sentience and a taste for playing practical jokes on the crew.

episodes.title: Albatross
episodes.description: Dr. McCoy is arrested and charged with causing an alien plague.

episodes.title: How Sharper Than a Serpent's Tooth
episodes.description: The Enterprise runs into a being which once visited Earth and influenced the Mayan culture.

episodes.title: The Counter-Clock Incident
episodes.description: The Enterprise finds itself trapped in a 'negative universe' which causes the crew to begin to grow younger and younger toward infancy.

show.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
show.description: Set almost 100 years after Captain Kirk's 5-year mission, a new generation of Starfleet officers sets off in the U.S.S. Enterprise-D on its own mission to go where no one has gone before.

episodes.title: Encounter at Farpoint
episodes.description: On the maiden mission of the U.S.S. Enterprise (NCC-1701-D), an omnipotent being known as Q challenges the crew to discover the secret of a mysterious base in an advanced and civilized fashion.

episodes.title: The Naked Now
episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise is infected with a virus that causes them to behave as though they were intoxicated.

episodes.title: Code of Honor
episodes.description: When the leader of an alien culture takes a romantic interest in Lt. Yar, he claims her for his own, to the dismay of his own wife, who, in turn, challenges Tasha in a fight to the death.

episodes.title: The Last Outpost
episodes.description: The Enterprise makes a confrontational first contact with the piratical Ferengi race as their two ships are ensnared by a presumed dead planet ready to judge them.

episodes.title: Where No One Has Gone Before
episodes.description: Everyone accurately pegs a visiting propulsion scientist as a charlatan, but only Wesley Crusher recognizes his alien assistant as the real deal.

episodes.title: Lonely Among Us
episodes.description: While distracted by two antithetical races applying for Federation membership, the Enterprise picks up a sentient entity that can alternately possess either man or machinery.

episodes.title: Justice
episodes.description: On an alien planet, young Wesley Crusher commits a transgression - small by our standards but mandatorily punishable by death in theirs.

episodes.title: The Battle
episodes.description: Beware Ferengi bearing gifts. Capt. Picard receives the Stargazer, a ship considered lost that he once commanded.

episodes.title: Hide and Q
episodes.description: The Enterprise encounters Q again, and he tempts Riker by endowing him with the powers of the Q.

episodes.title: Haven
episodes.description: While on a mission to a planet called Haven, Counselor Troi meets her husband to be, a marriage arranged by her father years before, as the Enterprise encounters a ship far deadlier than any combat could provide.

episodes.title: The Big Goodbye
episodes.description: Captain Picard and some of his crew are caught in a deadly trap in the holodeck as the result of a ship-wide scan from an alien race.

episodes.title: Datalore
episodes.description: The Enterprise visits the planet where Data was created and discovers another android like him, but when he's assembled, he's not exactly like him.

episodes.title: Angel One
episodes.description: Riker, Troi, Data and Yar beam down to a planet ruled by a matriarchal government in the hopes of locating a missing freighter crew.
The Enterprise docks at a starbase for repairs where it is commandeered by a race of technologically-linked aliens intent on using the vessel for their own purposes.

episodes.title: Too Short a Season
episodes.description: The Enterprise transports an elderly Starfleet Admiral to negotiate a hostage crisis. When the Admiral takes a de-aging drug, he endangers both his life and the mission.

episodes.title: When the Bough Breaks
episodes.description: A planet that was able to cloak itself for thousands of years suddenly reveals itself, with its inhabitants proposing peace. But, after initial negotiations, children of the Enterprise are kidnapped due to the infertility of the inhabitants.

episodes.title: Home Soil
episodes.description: On Velara III, Geordi and Data discover a microscopic life form responsible for the death of an engineer stationed on the base.

episodes.title: Coming of Age
episodes.description: Picard finds himself facing a strenuous test of his loyalty to Starfleet, one which the other members of the crew are struggling to cope with, whilst Wesley faces an equally challenging entrance exam at Starfleet Academy.

episodes.title: Heart of Glory
episodes.description: The Enterprise searches for answers as to why three Klingon warriors were the only survivors aboard a freighter just inside the Neutral Zone which was seemingly attacked by a Ferengi ship.

episodes.title: The Arsenal of Freedom
episodes.description: The Enterprise encounters a planet long dead, but technical equipment still functions for the purpose of selling off its arsenal, along with self sufficiency.

episodes.title: Symbiosis
episodes.description: The Enterprise encounters two neighboring cultures, one suffering from a plague, the other marketing a cure, and learns that nothing is as simple as it seems.

episodes.title: Skin of Evil
episodes.description: Counselor Troi is held captive on a deserted planet by a slick, black, oily, sentient and immortal puddle of evil.

episodes.title: We'll Always Have Paris
episodes.description: A scientist's experiment in time goes awry, reuniting Picard with an old flame, now married to the scientist.

episodes.title: Conspiracy
episodes.description: After diverting to a secret meeting with an old friend and some of Starfleet's finest commanders, Picard finds the Horatio blown to bits just hours after the meeting and he returns the Enterprise to Earth looking for answers.

episodes.title: The Neutral Zone
episodes.description: While assigned to investigate missing outposts in the Neutral Zone, the Enterprise revives three cryogenically frozen people found aboard a wayward derelict Earth vessel.

episodes.title: The Child
episodes.description: Deanna is impregnated by an unknown alien life-form, and Dr. Katherine Pulaski joins the Enterprise as the ship's new Chief Medical Officer.

episodes.title: Where Silence Has Lease
episodes.description: The Enterprise encounters a mysterious void in space and when they move in closer to investigate further, it envelops them and they can't get out.

episodes.title: Elementary, Dear Data
episodes.description: An attempt to provide Data with a challenging Sherlock Holmes holodeck program backfires when its Professor Moriarty character accidentally becomes self-aware.

episodes.title: The Outrageous Okona
episodes.description: The Enterprise rescues the captain of a broken-down freighter, only to become involved in a dispute between feuding worlds--each demanding custody of their guest. Data seeks help from Guinan in understanding humor.

episodes.title: Loud as a Whisper
episodes.description: The crew ferries a deaf mediator to Solais V to negotiate an end to a civil war.

episodes.title: The Schizoid Man
episodes.description: A dying anti-social scientist unintentionally comes upon the perfect vessel in which to preserve his intellect and arrogant personality - Data.

episodes.title: Unnatural Selection
episodes.description: Enhanced DNA developments trigger an epidemic of rapid aging. Caught among its victims - Dr. Pulaski.

episodes.title: A Matter of Honor
episodes.description: Under an Officers Exchange Program, Riker serves aboard a Klingon ship, whose aging captain seeks an unwarranted bloody retaliation for suspected Enterprise treachery.

episodes.title: The Measure of a Man
episodes.description: When Data resigns his commission rather than be dismantled for examination by an inadequately skilled scientist, a formal hearing is convened to determine whether Data is considered property without rights or is a sentient being.

episodes.title: The Dauphin
episodes.description: Wesley falls for the young future leader of Daled IV, unaware just how dangerous the girl's protective and overly restrictive guardian can be.

episodes.title: Contagion
episodes.description: Encountering the superior technology of a very ancient race creates system malfunctions for a doomed Federation starship, for the Enterprise, and for an eavesdropping Romulan warbird.

episodes.title: The Royale
episodes.description: Worf, Data, and Riker find themselves trapped in a re-creation of a poorly written novel.

episodes.title: Time Squared
episodes.description: The Enterprise comes across its own shuttlecraft adrift in space - a duplicate - with an unconscious duplicate Capt. Picard inside.

episodes.title: The Icarus Factor
episodes.description: Riker's delight at being offered a command of the USS Ares turns to frustration when the man sent to prepare him for his mission is his estranged father; Worf's behavior leads Wesley to delve into Klingon tradition.

episodes.title: Pen Pals
episodes.description: Data befriends an alien girl in distress, breaking the Prime Directive, while Wesley commands his first team.

episodes.title: Q Who
episodes.description: Q tries to prove that Picard needs him as part of their crew by hurling the Enterprise 7,000 light years away where they encounter the Borg for the first time.

episodes.title: Samaritan Snare
episodes.description: With Picard away for routine surgery, the Enterprise responds to an apparent distress call from a Pakled vessel.

episodes.title: Up the Long Ladder
episodes.description: An antiquated distress signal leads to two lost 22nd century Earth colonies, each facing doom in different ways, one by fire, the other by prolonged cloning.

episodes.title: Manhunt
episodes.description: A midlife Betazoid condition renders Ambassador Troi hot on the hunt for romance and wedlock with Captain Picard - or any man.

episodes.title: The Emissary
episodes.description: The Enterprise addresses the emergency of an old Klingon ship coming out of stasis and ready to fight the Federation. A half-Human/half Klingon emissary arrives to help, who once knew Worf intimately.

episodes.title: Peak Performance
episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise participates in war games.

episodes.title: Shades of Gray
episodes.description: When Commander Riker comes down with a dangerous alien infection after an away mission, the only way to treat it may be through reliving his memories.

episodes.title: Evolution
episodes.description: Wesley's latest science project escapes the lab, threatening the Enterprise and an eminent scientist's life-long project.

episodes.title: The Ensigns of Command
episodes.description: After 111 years of silence, an extremely litigious alien race asserts its agreed upon right to wipe out a Federation colony in its territory.

episodes.title: The Survivors
episodes.description: The Enterprise responds to a distress call from Rana IV, a Federation colony that is under attack from an unknown alien ship. When they arrive, they find the entire surface of the planet destroyed, save for a single house and two occupants.

episodes.title: Who Watches the Watchers
episodes.description: A proto-Vulcan culture worships Captain Picard and prepares to offer Counselor Troi as a sacrifice.

episodes.title: The Bonding
episodes.description: A startling surprise awaits the crew of the Enterprise when a mission costs the life of a crew member, who left her son behind.

episodes.title: Booby Trap
episodes.description: The Enterprise triggers an ancient yet effective trap left by an extinct race, with a perfectly preserved derelict ship serving as cheese for Picard.

episodes.title: The Enemy
episodes.description: La Forge gets left behind on a storm-plagued planet when the rest of his team encounters a Romulan warrior.

episodes.title: The Price
episodes.description: While the Enterprise hosts negotiations for control of a stable wormhole, Troi forms a personal relationship with an opposing negotiator, unaware of his true being.

episodes.title: The Vengeance Factor
episodes.description: The Enterprise pursues a race of "gatherers" who continue to raid Federation outposts, unaware of the dangers lurking among them.

episodes.title: The Defector
episodes.description: When a Romulan officer defects to the Federation with a warning of a impending invasion, Capt. Picard struggles to decide if he is to be believed.

episodes.title: The Hunted
episodes.description: Investigating a planet applying for membership into the Federation, the crew of the Enterprise finds a group of inhabitants who used to be soldiers, but now fight for their very existence.

episodes.title: The High Ground
episodes.description: While visiting a planet under civil war, Dr. Crusher is taken hostage by an opposing faction of the planet's ruling government.

episodes.title: Deja Q
episodes.description: Much to Picard's displeasure, Q reappears on the Enterprise, claiming to have been ejected from the Q Continuum, and therefore, lost his powers.

episodes.title: A Matter of Perspective
episodes.description: The widow of respected scientist Dr. Nel Apgar accuses Riker of seducing her and killing her husband. Rather than turn Riker over for unfavorable trial, the Enterprise reconstructs the facts.

episodes.title: Yesterday's Enterprise
episodes.description: The Enterprise C enters the Enterprise D's time and space continuum, where they find Picard and crew in a constant state of war with the Klingons, and only Guinan knows it.

episodes.title: The Offspring
episodes.description: After returning from a cybernetics conference to the Enterprise, Data creates his own "child," much to the chagrin of his captain, and without regards to the ramifications with Starfleet.

episodes.title: Sins of the Father
episodes.description: A Klingon commander comes aboard the Enterprise in an officer exchange program initiated by Starfleet, much to the chagrin of the crew.

episodes.title: Allegiance
episodes.description: Picard is kidnapped and held with three different aliens and meanwhile replaced with a replica as impostor captain.

episodes.title: Captain's Holiday
episodes.description: After mediating a difficult trade agreement, Captain Picard is encouraged to take a much needed rest on a vacationing planet, where he's visited by a strange race from the future, in search of a dangerous weapon.

episodes.title: Tin Man
episodes.description: The Enterprise reaches out to an alien being, while dancing around with the Romulans, who want to attack it in an act of vengeance.

episodes.title: Hollow Pursuits
episodes.description: A shy member of the "Enterprise" crew becomes addicted to the holodeck, where relationships are easier than in real life, when his knowledge is needed in engineering.

episodes.title: The Most Toys
episodes.description: When transporting a dangerous material to the Enterprise, Data is kidnapped and the crew is led to believe he is dead when the shuttlecraft he was piloting explodes en route.

episodes.title: Sarek
episodes.description: Legendary Federation ambassador Sarek visits the Enterprise to conclude peace talks with a race called the Legarans. His arrival is accompanied with a rash of unusual emotional outbursts among the crew.

episodes.title: Ménage à Troi
episodes.description: When Deanna's mother spurns advances made by a Ferengi Daimon, he takes it upon himself to kidnap the two of them, along with Commander Riker and steal them away aboard his ship.

episodes.title: Transfigurations
episodes.description: The Enterprise finds a deserted planet where a ship has crashed, and, with it, the lone survivor with no memory, but extraordinary healing powers.

episodes.title: The Best of Both Worlds
episodes.description: Responding to a distress call on one of the Federation's outer-most colonies, the Enterprise arrives...only to find a big hole in the ground where the town used to be, and discovers the Borg are behind the attack.

episodes.title: The Best of Both Worlds Part II
episodes.description: Having absorbed Captain Picard and his knowledge, the Borg head for Earth, leaving Riker and the Enterprise desperate for an unanticipated way to defeat them.

episodes.title: Family
episodes.description: After defeating the Borg, the crew of the Enterprise experiences shore leave in various ways. Captain Picard's return to his family's vineyard in France has some extraordinary repercussions.

episodes.title: Brothers
episodes.description: After an accident aboard the Enterprise leaves one of its children in grave danger, Data commandeers the Enterprise, driven to take the ship to an unknown origin, where an interesting figure awaits.

episodes.title: Suddenly Human
episodes.description: On a mission to an alien training mission, they discover one of its trainees to be a human.

episodes.title: Remember Me
episodes.description: Dr. Crusher's fear of losing loved ones becomes real when her worries create an alternate reality.

episodes.title: Legacy
episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise enters into orbit around the home planet of their former crewmate, Tasha Yar, where they encounter her sister.

episodes.title: Reunion
episodes.description: When the leader of the Klingon High Council dies, Picard finds himself in the middle of the struggle for the now-vacant position. Meanwhile, Worf reunites with a past love, only to find he now has a son.

episodes.title: Future Imperfect
episodes.description: Riker awakens sixteen years after an away mission where he contracted a disease which destroyed his memory back to the point of infection - or so he's told.

episodes.title: Final Mission
episodes.description: Before leaving for Starfleet Academy, Wesley Crusher accompanies Captain Picard on a dangerous mission.

episodes.title: The Loss
episodes.description: As an unknown force drags the Enterprise, Deanna Troi struggles with the loss of her empathic abilities.

episodes.title: Data's Day
episodes.description: Data tries to comprehend the complex emotions between O'Brien and Keiko, who are about to be married.

episodes.title: The Wounded
episodes.description: After being fired upon by a Cardassian vessel, Picard races against time to find out the facts behind the Cardassian commander's claim that the Federation attacked one of their outposts.

episodes.title: Devil's Due
episodes.description: While answering a distress call, Picard finds himself not sure of exactly who he is dealing with, but he's sure he's not dealing with the planet's version of the Devil, as she claims to be.

episodes.title: Clues
episodes.description: Effects of passing through a wormhole give the Enterprise crew a sense that they were unconscious for more than the thirty seconds they've been led to believe.

episodes.title: First Contact
episodes.description: Disguised as an alien prior to First Contact, Will's life becomes imperiled when incurred injuries reveal his foreign internal structure to a xenophobic alien population.

episodes.title: Galaxy's Child
episodes.description: As Geordi La Forge finally meets the real Dr. Leah Brahms, a tragic first contact leaves the Enterprise with a gigantic galactic infant suckling the ship's energy.

episodes.title: Night Terrors
episodes.description: The Enterprise gets trapped in a Tyken's Rift, an energy-absorbing rupture in space, where all but Data, Troi and Guinan experience rising hallucinations and paranoia.

episodes.title: Identity Crisis
episodes.description: Lt. Commander Geordi La Forge and an old friend fight to defeat a parasite that is trying to transform them into another species.

episodes.title: The Nth Degree
episodes.description: When assigned to investigate an unknown probe, Lt. Barclay is hit by an energy surge, through a shuttlecraft's computer, and he receives an inexplicable boost of confidence and a vast increase in his knowledge.

episodes.title: Qpid
episodes.description: Aiming to get out of Jean-Luc's debt, Q forces Capt. Picard and his officers to live out the Legend of Robin Hood - with a past acquaintance as Maid Marian.

episodes.title: The Drumhead
episodes.description: A retired admiral boards the Enterprise in an effort to determine the actions aboard the ship surrounding an act of sabotage and possible treason.

episodes.title: Half a Life
episodes.description: Counselor Troi's mother visits the Enterprise and becomes infatuated with a man whose culture forces him into a suicidal ritual called "The Resolution."

episodes.title: The Host
episodes.description: Dr. Crusher falls for someone who's not at all what she expects him to be.

episodes.title: The Mind's Eye
episodes.description: Geordi is brainwashed by the Romulans to start a war between the Klingons and the Federation.

episodes.title: In Theory
episodes.description: When a female crew member is infatuated with Lieutenant Commander Data, he decides to give a romantic relationship a try. Also, the Enterprise finds itself having to maneuver through a dangerous nebula.

episodes.title: Redemption
episodes.description: Both Captain Picard and Lt. Worf must decide where their priorities lie as the Klingon Empire descends into a bitter civil war.

episodes.title: Redemption II
episodes.description: As Worf fights in the Klingon Civil War, Captain Picard and his crew must stop the Romulans from helping their pawns achieve victory.

episodes.title: Darmok
episodes.description: Picard must learn to communicate with a race that speaks in metaphor under a difficult set of circumstances.

episodes.title: Ensign Ro
episodes.description: Captain Picard foils a plot against the Bajorans with his new Bajoran officer, Ensign Ro.

episodes.title: Silicon Avatar
episodes.description: The Crystalline Entity returns, and the Enterprise takes aboard a scientist to help track it down, but her personal agenda does not match Capt. Picard's.

episodes.title: Disaster
episodes.description: Collision with a quantum filament leaves Troi in charge of a damaged and endangered Enterprise with emergency bulkheads cutting off sections of the ship.

episodes.title: The Game
episodes.description: Wesley Crusher returns to the Enterprise on vacation from the Academy only to discover a mysterious alien game infiltrating and controlling the crew.

episodes.title: Unification I
episodes.description: Picard and Data follow Spock into Romulan space on a dangerous mission.

episodes.title: Unification II
episodes.description: On Romulus, Picard finds Spock, as well as an underground peace movement, a double agent, a bold ulterior motive against the Federation, and a familiar adversary.

episodes.title: A Matter of Time
episodes.description: Reaching Penthara IV after an asteroid wreaks havoc of catastrophic proportions, the Enterprise crew deals with trying to save the planet as well as deal with someone who claims to be a historian from the future.

episodes.title: New Ground
episodes.description: Geordi can barely curtail his enthusiasm at being able to test out a new theory of transportation, as Worf's mother boards the Enterprise with his son and news that Worf's Earthly parents can no longer care for him.

episodes.title: Hero Worship
episodes.description: Data rescues an orphaned boy named Timothy from a damaged ship. As a way to repress his own pain, Timothy begins to mimic Data's personality.

episodes.title: Violations
episodes.description: Transporting three Ullian mind-probing historians, the Enterprise crew is stymied when some of its members fall into a coma. Deanna Troi, the first crew member to come through it, cannot recall anything surrounding the incident.

episodes.title: The Masterpiece Society
episodes.description: Working together to prevent the annihilation of a perfectly balanced, isolated society (with no contingency for outside visitors) may, in fact, destroy it.

episodes.title: Conundrum
episodes.description: When an approaching alien ship wipes their memory, the crew struggles to put back together what happened.

episodes.title: Power Play
episodes.description: A long-lost ship is found on a planet where cosmic storms prevented detection for 200 years. When a surface landing goes wrong, the away team is beamed back...with a few extra surprises.

episodes.title: Ethics
episodes.description: After an accident that leaves him no longer able to walk, Worf asks Riker to help him commit suicide.

episodes.title: The Outcast
episodes.description: While aiding an androgynous race who lost a couple of members in an unmapped region of space, Riker falls for one of them, which can lead to trouble if detected, since the alien race does not endorse gender specificity.

episodes.title: Cause and Effect
episodes.description: The Enterprise gets caught in a time loop which always has one result: total destruction of the ship itself.

episodes.title: The First Duty
episodes.description: Wesley Crusher's team has an accident at Starfleet Academy. Picard offers to help a Starfleet investigation as to what happened, and begins to suspect they are hiding something.

episodes.title: Cost of Living
episodes.description: As undetectable parasites devour the ship, Deanna's mother arrives, taking young Alexander under her wing en route to meeting a man she's blindly agreed to marry.

episodes.title: The Perfect Mate
episodes.description: Ferengi machinations unleash a diplomatic gift aboard the Enterprise - the rare, empathic perfect mate, ready to bond with any male around her.

episodes.title: Imaginary Friend
episodes.description: A powerful, potentially dangerous energy life form, intent on scouting out the Enterprise, steps into the role of a girl's imaginary friend.

episodes.title: I Borg
episodes.description: The Enterprise finds a lone Borg drone, separated from the collective, and brings him aboard. The drone begins to reassert his individuality, but his presence causes differing levels of fear and sympathy from various crew members.

episodes.title: The Next Phase
episodes.description: A transporter malfunction, combined with a Romulan ship under stress and a damaged cloaking device, creates the illusion that Ensign Ro and Geordi are dead, but Geordi doesn't believe it to be so, and he acts accordingly.

episodes.title: The Inner Light
episodes.description: Picard awakes to find himself living in a small village where he is a well-known member of the community who is suffering from a delusion of being a starship captain.

episodes.title: Time's Arrow
episodes.description: Captain Picard and his archaeological curiosity are called upon by scientists from Earth when they find evidence to support beliefs that aliens had visited Earth in the late 1800s.

episodes.title: Time's Arrow, Part II
episodes.description: Captain Picard and crew follow Data back to the late 1800s to get him back, only to find the suspected alien visitors killing people of that time.

episodes.title: Realm of Fear
episodes.description: Overcoming his fear of transporter, Lt. Barclay joins an away team, only to find something in the beam with him.

episodes.title: Man of the People
episodes.description: When the Enterprise comes to the rescue of an ambassador and his "mother", Deanna finds herself attracted to him, and seeks to comfort him upon her death.

episodes.title: Relics
episodes.description: The Enterprise stumbles upon a Dyson sphere, with a ship crashed on the outer surface. An away team finds some systems still powered up and the chief engineer from the old Enterprise, Montgomery Scott, locked in the transporter cycle.

episodes.title: Schisms
episodes.description: Commander Riker's inability to fall asleep begins to show in other members of the crew in other forms, putting the Enterprise on the trail of a mystery.

episodes.title: True Q
episodes.description: When an honor student in the medical field is assigned to the Enterprise in an internship manner, she begins to demonstrate powers of the Q, prompting you-know-who to show up.

episodes.title: Rascals
episodes.description: An emergency beam out renders four crewmen down to childhood shortly before renegade Ferengi take over the Enterprise and offload the adults.

episodes.title: A Fistful of Datas
episodes.description: While the crew is experiencing some much needed down time, Worf and his son go on an Old West excursion in the holodeck, where they meet several versions of Data serving as the bad guy after an experiment in Engineering goes wrong.

episodes.title: The Quality of Life
episodes.description: When Geordi is assigned to survey a new mining development with Dr. Farallon, who invented an experimental mining technology, she uses a new sophisticated robot called an Exocomp to repair a power grid.

episodes.title: Chain of Command, Part I
episodes.description: Picard is replaced as captain of the Enterprise so he, Lt. Worf and Dr. Crusher go on a top-secret mission into Cardassian space. Meanwhile, his replacement, Captain Jellico, meets his new command with some resistance from the crew.

episodes.title: Chain of Command, Part II
episodes.description: While the humorless Captain Jellico leads the endeavor to prevent a Cardassian invasion, Picard is captured and tortured by a ruthless interrogator in an attempt to break him.

episodes.title: Ship in a Bottle
episodes.description: Lt. Barclay mistakenly awakes Moriarty in the forgotten holodeck program, who then makes his demands clear and unforgettable.

episodes.title: Aquiel
episodes.description: Murderous intrigue abounds for the Enterprise when one of the crew aboard a subspace station is believed dead, and suspected to have taken part in it until the Klingons show up with the young lieutenant, to Geordi's taste.

episodes.title: Face of the Enemy
episodes.description: Deanna awakes to find herself altered to look like a Romulan, immediately unaware she's involved in a cat-and-mouse game as a member of their intelligence agency.

episodes.title: Tapestry
episodes.description: When Captain Picard's artificial heart fails, he is offered the rare opportunity to go back in time and set right the mistake that led to his demise.

episodes.title: Birthright, Part I
episodes.description: While visiting Deep Space 9, a Yridian tells Worf his father lives, and a discharge from an alien device puts Data in a dream state where he meets his own father.

episodes.title: Birthright, Part II
episodes.description: In seeking his father, Worf discovers a prisoner-of-war camp that has evolved into a Klingon/Romulan haven - an Eden where Worf becomes their serpent.

episodes.title: Starship Mine
episodes.description: When the Enterprise puts in to space dock for an energy sweep of the ship which is lethal to humans, Picard gets trapped on board with technicians who are not what they appear to be.

episodes.title: Lessons
episodes.description: Picard falls for the new head of the stellar science services department, but has feelings of misgivings when he's forced to assign her to a dangerous mission.

episodes.title: The Chase
episodes.description: The crew of the Enterprise must race against various rival powers to uncover an archaeological secret that explains the predominance of humanoid life forms in the galaxy.

episodes.title: Frame of Mind
episodes.description: Riker begins to question reality when he finds himself in an alien insane asylum and faces the prospect his life on the Enterprise has been a delusion.

episodes.title: Suspicions
episodes.description: Dr. Crusher puts her career on the line to prove a scientist's theoretical new shielding technology which may have cost him his life.

episodes.title: Rightful Heir
episodes.description: During Worf's crisis of faith on Boreth, Kahless the Unforgettable makes his promised legendary return, but Klingon leader Gowron challenges his authenticity.

episodes.title: Second Chances
episodes.description: Riker's exact duplicate is discovered on Nervala IV. His first order of business: resume his relationship with Deanna. Second order: obey orders from his superior - himself.

episodes.title: Timescape
episodes.description: Aboard a shuttlecraft and en route back to the Enterprise, Picard, LaForge, Data, and Troi find themselves trapped in a time trap of some sort, where the Enterprise is being taken over by Romulans, and the ship, itself, on a course of destruction.

episodes.title: Descent
episodes.description: When Data experiences his first emotion, anger, after an encounter with the Borg, Data tries hard to recreate the experience, and he is blind as to what the consequences will be. Meanwhile, the rest of the Enterprise investigate the mystery as to why the Borg they faced seemed to have names and feelings of their own.

episodes.title: Descent, Part II
episodes.description: Before Lore can run risky experiments on Geordi, Troi and Picard, the three seek a way to re-boot Data's ethical program that Lore switched off to pull Data to his side.

episodes.title: Liaisons
episodes.description: On a diplomatic mission, Worf, Troi and the Captain deal with three aliens who explore foreign concepts with extreme, singular focus.

episodes.title: Interface
episodes.description: Geordi is distracted by the news of the possible loss of his mother while he uses a new remote probe technology to search for a downed spacecraft.

episodes.title: Gambit, Part I
episodes.description: While investigating the apparent death of Capt. Picard, Riker is abducted by a group of intergalactic archaeological thieves, only to find Picard has apparently joined their ranks.

episodes.title: Gambit, Part II
episodes.description: Riker and Picard must find out why this intergalactic gang is looting archaeological sites.

episodes.title: Phantasms
episodes.description: Data deals with his new ability to experience nightmares as the Enterprise deals with the installation of a new warp core that won't work as expected.

episodes.title: Dark Page
episodes.description: While establishing diplomatic relations with an alien race called the Cairn, Deanna's mother experiences a mental breakdown and falls into a coma, and it seems like Deanna is the only one who is able to help her, even if her mother doesn't want it.

episodes.title: Attached
episodes.description: Captain Picard and Dr. Crusher discover things about one another when they are captured by an opposing alien race, due to the fact that the Enterprise has come to allow the planet's other civilization the choice of being part of the Federation.

episodes.title: Force of Nature
episodes.description: While searching for a missing Federation medical transport, the Enterprise is accosted by two scientists from a nearby planet who claim that cumulative exposure to warp energy is weakening the fabric of space.

episodes.title: Inheritance
episodes.description: On Federation planet Atrea IV, Data encounters the former wife of his creator Noonian Soong who claims to be his "mother".

episodes.title: Parallels
episodes.description: On his return from a bat'leth competition in the Klingon Empire, Worf finds himself shifting realities where events and details are in a constant state of flux and only he is aware of the changes.

episodes.title: The Pegasus
episodes.description: Riker finds out his former commander from the starship Pegasus has orders that entail more than what is revealed to Picard, who thinks the Enterprise is en route to recover the lost ship. And Riker is ordered to secrecy.

episodes.title: Homeward
episodes.description: In an attempt to preserve a race of people on a planet being bombarded by storms that would kill them, Worf's foster brother violates the Prime Directive, leaving the Enterprise crew in a difficult position.

episodes.title: Sub Rosa
episodes.description: Dr. Crusher meets the man in her dead grandmother's life when she tries to put her affairs in order, whom one of the local people warn her to stay away from by not lighting a candle that has been lit for generations.

episodes.title: Lower Decks
episodes.description: A mission of the Enterprise is seen through the eyes of some junior officers who are up for promotions, as questions of duty and honor arise among some of them, such as a Bajoran whom Worf has designated to be promoted to operations.

episodes.title: Thine Own Self
episodes.description: Data is sent to follow a probe that has drifted off course and crashed on a primitive planet, only to crash on the planet himself, with no memory of any event prior to crashing on the planet's surface.

episodes.title: Masks
episodes.description: Investigating a rogue comet that's been traveling throughout the universe for over 87 million years, Picard discovers alien beings within the comet, which infest the computer systems on the Enterprise, as well as Data.

episodes.title: Eye of the Beholder
episodes.description: As a young lieutenant aboard the Enterprise commits suicide, his shipmates deal with the loss and Deanna deals with feelings surrounding her as she and Worf begin to form a relationship.

episodes.title: Genesis
episodes.description: When a new torpedo guidance system malfunctions, Picard and Data go chasing after it into an asteroid field, while the crew is left behind to deal with their own strange behaviors.

episodes.title: Journey's End
episodes.description: After the Federation grants access by the Cardassians to a planet already inhabited by Native Americans, Picard has the daunting task of relocating them.

episodes.title: Firstborn
episodes.description: In an effort to help him accept his Klingon heritage, Worf and his son, Alexander, attend an ancient Klingon ceremony.

episodes.title: Bloodlines
episodes.description: Picard races the Ferengi in an effort to track down the son he never knew he had.

episodes.title: Emergence
episodes.description: Strange images begin appearing throughout the ship's decks and holodecks. Data and the rest of the crew begin to investigate only to discover that the ship's computer itself is exhibiting the strange behavior as it begins to become self-aware.

episodes.title: Preemptive Strike
episodes.description: Following her return from Advanced Tactical Training, Bajoran Ro Laren is sent to infiltrate the Maquis and finds herself torn between her loyalty to Picard and Starfleet, and her sympathy with the Maquis fighting "the good fight".

episodes.title: All Good Things...
episodes.description: Capt. Picard finds himself shifting continually into the past, future and present and must use that to discover a threat to humanity's existence.

show.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
show.description: In the vicinity of the liberated planet of Bajor, the Federation space station Deep Space Nine guards the opening of a stable wormhole to the far side of the galaxy.

episodes.title: Emissary
episodes.description: When the troubled Commander Sisko takes command of a surrendered space station, he learns that it borders a unique stable wormhole.

episodes.title: Past Prologue
episodes.description: Tahna Los, a former Bajoran terrorist during the Occupation, asks Sisko for asylum on DS9. Meanwhile, the station's last Cardassian inhabitant, Garak, possibly a former spy for the Cardassian government, proves an interesting mystery to Dr. Bashir.

episodes.title: A Man Alone
episodes.description: Ibudan, a criminal Odo has dealt with before, returns to DS9 only to be murdered shortly after - leaving Odo to be the prime suspect. Jake and Nog's trouble-making prompt Keiko to do something helpful for the station's children.

episodes.title: Babel
episodes.description: The crew and civilian population of Deep Space Nine begin to speak gibberish when a plague - an 'aphasia virus' - engineered by the Bajorans as a weapon against the Cardassians, accidentally gets released into the station's atmosphere.

episodes.title: Captive Pursuit
episodes.description: For the first time an alien comes from the other side of the wormhole. He has ship trouble and seems very reluctant to accept any help. Chief O'Brien quickly finds out he has a secret.

episodes.title: Q-Less
episodes.description: Q, the Enterprise-D's consistent omnipotent annoyance, comes to harass the DS9 crew when his traveling companion, Vash, refuses to travel with Q any longer.

episodes.title: Dax
episodes.description: Jadzia Dax is accused of a murder that her previous host, Curzon, supposedly committed.

episodes.title: The Passenger
episodes.description: Rao Vantika, a captured criminal, is badly burned and dies in Bashir's arms but the criminal's captor believes that he is still alive.

episodes.title: Move Along Home
episodes.description: The Wadi from the Gamma Quadrant visit DS9, thereby making first contact with the Federation. When they catch Quark cheating, they let him off by playing a special game.

episodes.title: The Nagus
episodes.description: The Ferengi leader, Grand Nagus Zek, comes to the station. He seems very interested in Quark's bar.

episodes.title: Vortex
episodes.description: A man named Croden tells Odo he can take him to a place where aliens much like Odo himself exist, which would help Odo find out where he truly comes from.

episodes.title: Battle Lines
episodes.description: While showing Bajoran spiritual leader Kai Opaka the wormhole, she, Sisko, Bashir and Kira crash land on a moon. The locals are in a never-ending war where they cannot die.

episodes.title: The Storyteller
episodes.description: While Sisko tries to negotiate an agreement between two Bajoran factions, he orders O'Brien to escort Bashir to investigate an emergency that endangers a village.

episodes.title: Progress
episodes.description: Kira must convince an old Bajoran farmer to leave a moon becoming uninhabitable due to mining operations. Jake and Nog try to trade off Cardassian yamok sauce.

episodes.title: If Wishes Were Horses
episodes.description: While Dax investigates an unusual energy reading near DS9 to see if it's dangerous for the station, people's imaginations suddenly come alive, causing chaos.

episodes.title: The Forsaken
episodes.description: Lwaxana Troi comes for a political visit and instead hounds Odo for romantic attention. Meanwhile, an alien probe wreaks havoc with the station's computer, leaving Odo and Lwaxana trapped together.

episodes.title: Dramatis Personae
episodes.description: The entire station's command staff, save Odo, become power hungry and vie to defeat each other by forming secret alliances and plotting assassinations. Odo tries to figure out the cause of this mysterious behavior.

episodes.title: Duet
episodes.description: A Cardassian suffering from Kalla-Nohra, a disease that indicates he served in a labor camp, visits DS9. Kira is determined to convict him as a war criminal.

episodes.title: In the Hands of the Prophets
episodes.description: Vedek Winn, a candidate in the race for the open Kai position, stirs up trouble on DS9 when she attempts to boycott Keiko's school for not teaching Bajoran religious beliefs.

episodes.title: The Homecoming
episodes.description: Word that a previously thought dead Bajoran resistance legend is still alive sends Kira and Chief O'Brien to Cardassia IV to rescue him; meanwhile "The Circle", a sect of the Bajoran provisional government that is intent on wiping out alien influence, is sneaking into power.

episodes.title: The Circle
episodes.description: Kira spends time with Vedek Bareil on Bajor just as the Circle begins receiving arms from an unknown source.

episodes.title: The Siege
episodes.description: As a Circle-led Bajoran military attempts to occupy the station, a skeleton crew, led by Sisko fight to reveal the Circle's secret before they're forced to evacuate themselves. Meanwhile, Kira and Dax lead a mission to reveal the truth about the Circle, on Bajor.

episodes.title: Invasive Procedures
episodes.description: A jealous Trill, who had waited his entire life to receive a symbiont but never did, decides to steal Dax's.

episodes.title: Cardassians
episodes.description: Political tensions rise on DS9 when Bajorans board the station with a supposedly orphaned Cardassian whom they have adopted.

episodes.title: Melora
episodes.description: Melora Pazlar, a new arrival on DS9 with a special gravity-based disability, finds an admirer in Bashir. Meanwhile, an old associate of Quark's comes to the station to kill the bartender.

episodes.title: Rules of Acquisition
episodes.description: A female Ferengi named Pel, posing as a male so that she can engage in business, falls for Quark during very important negotiations between the Ferengi and a Gamma Quadrant race.

episodes.title: Necessary Evil
episodes.description: Odo relives some terrible and tragic memories of a past investigation when he was the constable on Cardassian-occupied Deep Space Nine, then named Terok Nor.

episodes.title: Second Sight
episodes.description: While noted scientist Gideon Seyetik is preparing for an ambitious project, re-igniting a star, Sisko is intrigued by a woman who keeps disappearing.

episodes.title: Sanctuary
episodes.description: A race that has been conquered twice over, one of the conquerors being the mysterious Dominion, comes to the station seeking aid and a new home.

episodes.title: Rivals
episodes.description: Quark meets his match when a new rival opens a casino opposite his bar on the Promenade. Meanwhile, the station is suffering issues of high improbability.

episodes.title: The Alternate
episodes.description: Odo and his mentor Dr. Mora Pol discover a lifeform similar to Odo on a Gamma Quadrant planet.

episodes.title: Armageddon Game
episodes.description: Chief O'Brien, who still doesn't particularly like Doctor Bashir, must rely on him when the two are stranded on a planet and O'Brien is infected with a deadly, fast moving disease.

episodes.title: Whispers
episodes.description: Chief O'Brien's world is turned upside down when for no reason whatsoever he is being ignored by his family and friends and is being closed out of every essential job on the station.

episodes.title: Paradise
episodes.description: Sisko and Chief O'Brien discover a colony which lives without technology.

episodes.title: Shadowplay
episodes.description: Odo and Dax investigate the mysterious disappearance of people from a village. Kira tries to keep a close eye on Quark, while Vedek Bareil unexpectedly visits.

episodes.title: Playing God
episodes.description: A Trill named Arjin comes to DS9 to learn what it is to be a Trill with a symbiont but finds his teacher, Dax, to be less than he expected.

episodes.title: Profit and Loss
episodes.description: A Cardassian woman named Natima Lang, who was once a flame of Quark's, visits the station under dubious circumstances.

episodes.title: Blood Oath
episodes.description: Three legendary Klingons come to DS9 to see if Jadzia will participate in a blood oath that they made with Dax's previous host Curzon.

episodes.title: The Maquis, Part I
episodes.description: The destruction of a Cardassian ship leads Sisko, Dukat, and Sisko's old friend Cal Hudson to the fact that there is an unofficial war between the Maquis and the Cardassians.

episodes.title: The Maquis, Part II
episodes.description: Sisko tries to resolve the Maquis crisis by preventing a war, freeing Gul Dukat and offering the defected Hudson the chance to return.

episodes.title: The Wire
episodes.description: Dr. Bashir fights to save Garak's life when a device implanted in his brain, designed to alleviate pain in the event of torture, begins to malfunction and is slowly killing him.

episodes.title: Crossover
episodes.description: Kira and Bashir find themselves in an alternate universe.

episodes.title: The Collaborator
episodes.description: Vedek Bareil's targeted by fellow Kai candidate, Vedek Winn as having been a collaborator with the Cardassians during the Occupation.

episodes.title: Tribunal
episodes.description: Chief O'Brien goes through the horrific Cardassian judicial system when he is charged for an unknown crime.

episodes.title: The Jem'Hadar
episodes.description: While in the Gamma Quadrant, Sisko, Quark and a strange telepathic woman are captured by the Jem'Hadar, the soldiers of the Dominion.

episodes.title: The Search, Part I
episodes.description: Instead of waiting for the Jem'Hadar to attack, Sisko wants to try a different tactic; he wants to take a new class starship to try to find the Founders.

episodes.title: The Search, Part II
episodes.description: Odo has found his home and is introduced. Meanwhile Sisko finds out peace talks between the Dominion and the Federation have already started.

episodes.title: The House of Quark
episodes.description: Quark is forced to marry a Klingon widow after he takes credit for the accidental death of her husband, the head of a powerful Klingon House.

episodes.title: Equilibrium
episodes.description: The Trill homeworld is the setting, as Sisko and Bashir take Jadzia home for treatment when she begins experiencing hallucinations after playing a tune she can't recall.

episodes.title: Second Skin
episodes.description: Kira finds herself on Cardassia as a Cardassian. She is told she is called Iliana Ghemor and was a Cardassian spy.

episodes.title: The Abandoned
episodes.description: Odo tries to change the nature of a rapidly maturing infant Quark finds, while Sisko tries to break his son's relationship with a 20 year old Dabo girl.

episodes.title: Civil Defense
episodes.description: The station goes into lockdown and the crew is endangered when an old Cardassian security program is accidentally activated.

episodes.title: Meridian
episodes.description: Dax falls in love with one of the residents of a multi-dimensional planet, while on DS9 an alien requests a holosuite program of Kira from Quark.

episodes.title: Defiant
episodes.description: Riker arrives on the station to requisition the Defiant in order to fight with the Maquis. Sisko assists Gul Dukat on Cardassia Prime to prevent the ship from entering Cardassian territory.

episodes.title: Fascination
episodes.description: When Lwaxana Troi visits the station for the Bajoran Gratitude Festival, the crew is stricken with intense romantic attractions to one another.

episodes.title: Past Tense, Part I
episodes.description: Sisko, Bashir and Dax are accidentally sent to San Francisco in the 21st century due to a transporter malfunction, and must figure out how to get back to return without changing the time line.

episodes.title: Past Tense, Part II
episodes.description: Sisko is forced to take the place of a key historical figure on Earth in 2024 in order to preserve the timeline.

episodes.title: Life Support
episodes.description: Dr. Bashir must use extraordinary measures to prolong Vedek Bareil's life long enough to allow Bareil to complete sensitive peace negotiations between the Bajorans and the Cardassians.

episodes.title: Heart of Stone
episodes.description: After chasing a fugitive into a cave, Kira gets stuck and is slowly encapsulated by a growing crystal stone while Odo tries to figure out how to free her.

episodes.title: Destiny
episodes.description: Sisko faces a conflict between his Starfleet duties and his role as the Bajoran Emissary when an ancient Bajoran prophecy predicts a joint Federation-Cardassian project will lead to the destruction of the wormhole.

episodes.title: Prophet Motive
episodes.description: Grand Nagus Zek is acting bizarre by giving away money and rewriting the Rules of Acquisition. Quark attempts to get the old Nagus back.

episodes.title: Visionary
episodes.description: While a Romulan delegation tries to get information about the Dominion, O'Brien sees of unpleasant things that are about to happen in the future.

episodes.title: Distant Voices
episodes.description: After being attacked in the infirmary, Dr. Bashir has a dual mystery on his hands: what has happened to the station while he was out and why is he aging so rapidly now?

episodes.title: Through the Looking Glass
episodes.description: Sisko is kidnapped and forced to impersonate his deceased mirror universe counterpart in order to convince Jennifer Sisko to defect to the Terran Rebellion.

episodes.title: Improbable Cause
episodes.description: After an attempt is made on Garak's life, Odo conducts the investigation on who tried to murder the Cardassian tailor - and why.

episodes.title: The Die Is Cast
episodes.description: Now rejoined with his former mentor, Garak is ordered to interrogate Odo about the secrets of his people, while the joined Romulan/Cardassian attack fleet moves towards the Founders' home world on a mission of destruction.

episodes.title: Explorers
episodes.description: Sisko rebuilds an ancient Bajoran space vessel from the blueprints, and he and Jake take the ship on a trip, attempting to prove that the ancient Bajorans went beyond their solar system without warp drive.

episodes.title: Family Business
episodes.description: Quark and Rom return to the Ferengi home world because their mother has broken the law - by wearing clothes and earning profits, forbidden for women in Ferengi society.

episodes.title: Shakaar
episodes.description: News arrives that Kai Winn has also become Bajor's political leader. She asks Kira to negotiate with an old resistance friend about returning soil reclamators.

episodes.title: Facets
episodes.description: Dax asks the crew to join her Zhian'tara ritual. The memories of her former hosts will take over their bodies. Nog is preparing for Starfleet Academy.

episodes.title: The Adversary
episodes.description: The Defiant is off to show the Federation's presence to the new Tzenkethi government. While underway the ship malfunctions and repeated instances leads Sisko to believe a changeling's onboard, engaging in sabotage.

episodes.title: The Way of the Warrior
episodes.description: Sisko becomes uncomfortable when the Klingons station a task force to help defend against the Dominion. Worf is summoned to find out their true intentions.

episodes.title: The Visitor
episodes.description: Melanie, an aspiring writer, wants to know why Jake Sisko stopped writing at 40. Jake tells how his father died in an accident and then suddenly reappeared.

episodes.title: Hippocratic Oath
episodes.description: Bashir is asked to help a group of renegade Jem'Hadar break their addiction to ketracel white. Meanwhile Worf is dissatisfied with the way Odo runs security.

episodes.title: Indiscretion
episodes.description: Kira and Gul Dukat go after the lost prison ship Ravinok. Dukat has a secret. Meanwhile Kasidy Yates tries to find work near Bajor, leaving Sisko uncomfortable.

episodes.title: Rejoined
episodes.description: Lenara Kahn, the new host of the wife of Dax's former host Torias, comes to the station. While they're not allowed to renew their relation, there's still a spark.

episodes.title: Little Green Men
episodes.description: Quark and Rom take Nog to Earth and Starfleet Academy, but a malfunction with the ship takes the crew back in time, to Roswell, New Mexico in 1947.

episodes.title: Starship Down
episodes.description: A damaged Defiant must play a dangerous game of cat-and-mouse with two Jem'Hadar ships inside a gas giant.

episodes.title: The Sword of Kahless
episodes.description: Worf, Dax and the Klingon Dahar master Kor set out to find an ancient lost relic: the Sword of Kahless.

episodes.title: Our Man Bashir
episodes.description: When a transporter emergency turns the command crew into holosuite characters, Bashir's James Bond fantasy takes on a deadly reality.

episodes.title: Homefront
episodes.description: Sisko travels to Earth when a bombing at a Federation conference is determined to be the work of Changelings.

episodes.title: Paradise Lost
episodes.description: When Starfleet institutes martial law to combat the Changeling Menace, Sisko begins to question if the Dominion is the real threat.

episodes.title: Crossfire
episodes.description: First Minister Shakaar visits the station, despite a threat of assassination. He falls in love with Kira much to Odo's dismay.

episodes.title: Return to Grace
episodes.description: Dukat returns, stripped of his prestige, to escort Kira to a Cardassian conference about the Dominion. But an attack by a Klingon raider may give Dukat a chance to redeem himself in the eyes of his government.

episodes.title: Sons of Mogh
episodes.description: Worf's brother Kurn asks him to perform a death rite to regain his lost honor. Meanwhile, Kira and O'Brien investigate Klingon activity near the Bajoran border.

episodes.title: Bar Association
episodes.description: Unfair working conditions and pay cuts cause Rom to organize a union of the employees of Quark's Bar. Meanwhile, Worf still finds it hard to settle on the station.

episodes.title: Accession
episodes.description: A man claiming to be the emissary comes through the wormhole. Sisko is happy to give up his position. Meanwhile Keiko returns and O'Brien stops spending time with Bashir.

episodes.title: Rules of Engagement
episodes.description: When Worf destroys a civilian shuttle during an engagement with the Klingons, an extradition hearing is held to see if he must face charges.

episodes.title: Hard Time
episodes.description: O'Brien tries to re-integrate to life on the station after serving 20 years in a virtual prison.

episodes.title: Shattered Mirror
episodes.description: When the Mirror Universe counterpart of Sisko's deceased wife lures Jake to the other side, Sisko must follow and help the Terran resistance against the Alliance forces.

episodes.title: The Muse
episodes.description: A mysterious woman approaches Jake about his future as a writer. Odo promises to do whatever it takes to help Lwaxana Troi keep her baby over the father's wishes - even if it means marrying her himself.

episodes.title: For the Cause
episodes.description: Sisko must face betrayal when evidence surfaces that Kasidy is smuggling for the Maquis. Meanwhile Garak makes acquaintance with Ziyal.

episodes.title: To the Death
episodes.description: A renegade group of Jem'Hadar plunders Deep Space Nine. Sisko agrees to a combat operation with loyal Jem'Hadar to prevent the renegades completing a planetary gateway.

episodes.title: The Quickening
episodes.description: Bashir tries to help a planet in the grips of a Dominion-engineered plague that guarantees a painful death.

episodes.title: Body Parts
episodes.description: Quark believes he's going to die, and Rom convinces him to sell his remains. After an accident, Bashir must move Keiko's fetus to Kira's womb.

episodes.title: Broken Link
episodes.description: Odo is suddenly struck by illness. He is barely able to hold shape. Bashir and Odo see no other alternative than going to the Founders. Garak wants to come along.

episodes.title: Apocalypse Rising
episodes.description: With the war between Klingons and Federation intensifying, Sisko must make a plan to expose Gowron as a changeling. Odo is still having trouble with becoming a solid.

episodes.title: The Ship
