episodes.description: The crew is forced to retreat in a crashed Jem'Hadar ship after an attack by the Jem'Hadar. They get the feeling there's something very important about this ship.

episodes.title: Looking for Par'Mach in All the Wrong Places
episodes.description: While Worf helps Quark to pursue his former wife Grilka, O'Brien and Kira grow uncomfortably close to each other.

episodes.title: Nor the Battle to the Strong
episodes.description: Jake, reporting from the front lines, sees what war truly is.

episodes.title: The Assignment
episodes.description: A Pah-wraith possesses Keiko's body and forces Chief O'Brien to complete a task, or Keiko'll be killed.

episodes.title: Trials and Tribble-ations
episodes.description: Sisko tells two men from Temporal Investigations how he and his crew went back in time to when Captain James Kirk of the first Starship Enterprise exposed a Klingon spy with the help of Tribbles.

episodes.title: Let He Who Is without Sin...
episodes.description: While vacationing on Risa, Worf and Dax meet a group of fundamentalist protesters who claim that the Federation has gone soft.

episodes.title: Things Past
episodes.description: Sisko, Dax, Odo and Garak find themselves in the past when the Cardassians controlled the station, and a crime that Odo investigated may be the key.

episodes.title: The Ascent
episodes.description: On their way to answer a warrant, Odo and Quark crash, and must put aside their differences to survive and signal for help.

episodes.title: Rapture
episodes.description: Sisko begins having visions that may show him how to best help Bajor, but they're killing him.

episodes.title: The Darkness and the Light
episodes.description: A mysterious assassin begins wiping out all the members of Kira's old resistance cell.

episodes.title: The Begotten
episodes.description: The discovery of an infant Changeling gives Odo a chance to correct what he sees as the "mistakes" in his upbringing. But as Starfleet's pressure for results grows, he has to turn to his "father," Dr. Mora.

episodes.title: For the Uniform
episodes.description: When the traitorous Eddington returns, Sisko will go to any lengths to capture him.

episodes.title: In Purgatory's Shadow
episodes.description: A coded message from the Gamma Quadrant leads Garak to believe his mentor, Enabran Tain, is still alive. He and Worf seek him out, only to discover something much worse: a Dominion invasion fleet poised to attack the Alpha Quadrant.

episodes.title: By Inferno's Light
episodes.description: The station readies for a Dominion attack. Worf and Garak meet some unexpected friends in a Dominion Prison camp.

episodes.title: Doctor Bashir, I Presume
episodes.description: Dr. Bashir is selected to be the model for the next-generation of Emergency Medical Hologram (EMH). But he balks when his parents are invited to the station to be interviewed by the EMH programmer, Dr. Zimmerman. There is a dark secret in his family that he's afraid that his parents will reveal.

episodes.title: A Simple Investigation
episodes.description: Odo becomes romantically attached to a woman working with the Orion Syndicate.

episodes.title: Business as Usual
episodes.description: Quark must wrestle with his conscience when he becomes involved with arms merchants.

episodes.title: Ties of Blood and Water
episodes.description: When a Cardassian official, who thinks of Kira as his daughter, is dying, he agrees to reveal all he knows to her. But the experience dredges up Kira's memories of her own father's death.

episodes.title: Ferengi Love Songs
episodes.description: Quark doesn't know whether to be panicked or overjoyed when he learns that his mother is the new lover of the Grand Nagus.

episodes.title: Soldiers of the Empire
episodes.description: Dax and Worf accompany Martok on his first command since being held by the Dominion. But the ship they are given hasn't seen victory in months and the crew is near mutinous.

episodes.title: Children of Time
episodes.description: The DS9 crew discovers a small colony on a remote world that was originally populated by them 200 years earlier due to a time-travel accident with the Defiant. The current colonists lives depend on making sure that accident happens again, even though they've now forwarned the crew that it will happen. Each crew member needs to decide if they are willing to give up their lives on DS9 in order to preserve the history of the colony.

episodes.title: Blaze of Glory
episodes.description: Driven to desperation by the Dominion, the Maquis launch a massive bio-weapons strike towards Cardassia. Sisko must trust the traitor Eddington to try to stop them.

episodes.title: Empok Nor
episodes.description: While salvaging components from DS9's sister station, the crew run afoul of a "surprise" left behind by the Cardassians.

episodes.title: In the Cards
episodes.description: Jake and Nog go through hell and high water, from participating in an auction to dealing with the Dominion, to receiving a Willie Mays baseball card, all in order to cheer up the war-fatigued Captain Sisko.

episodes.title: Call to Arms
episodes.description: Deep Space Nine prepares for a Dominion attack.

episodes.title: A Time to Stand
episodes.description: Borrowing a captured Jem'Hadar attack ship, Sisko and crew embark on a mission to destroy the hidden base where all of the ketracel-white is stored for the entire Alpha Quadrant.

episodes.title: Rocks and Shoals
episodes.description: Sisko and his crew crash on a barren world when their commandeered Jem'Hadar ship is shot down. They encounter Jem'Hadar who crashed there earlier, and have taken Nog and Garak hostage in exchange for medical aid for their Vorta overseer.

episodes.title: Sons and Daughters
episodes.description: Serving with his recruit son aboard a Klingon vessel, Worf finds his relationship with his son strained. Meanwhile, strained relationships abound on DS9 between Major Kira and Gul Dukat.

episodes.title: Behind the Lines
episodes.description: After forming an attack plan on the Dominion, Sisko relinquishes command of the Defiant to Dax after accepting a promotion. On DS9, the resistance faces discovery when Odo links with another changeling.

episodes.title: Favor the Bold
episodes.description: Sisko mounts an attack to re-take DS9, while Rom faces charges as an enemy of the Dominion state.

episodes.title: Sacrifice of Angels
episodes.description: The Federation attacks DS9 in hopes of keeping the mine field at the wormhole intact, while the Dominion waits entrance to the Alpha Quadrant from the other side.

episodes.title: You Are Cordially Invited
episodes.description: Suddenly desiring to wed within the week on DS9, Worf and Jadzia go through their own Klingon rituals: Worf on a four day bachelor party with the male members of the crew & Jadzia deals with her prospective mother-in-law, who totally opposes the idea of "an alien" marrying into her Klingon household.

episodes.title: Resurrection
episodes.description: Major Kira takes a romantic interest in the mirror universe counterpart of her deceased lover Bareil after he transports himself into her universe and onto DS9.

episodes.title: Statistical Probabilities
episodes.description: A group of genetically engineered humans are brought to Dr. Bashir on DS9 in the hopes of integrating them into wider society.

episodes.title: The Magnificent Ferengi
episodes.description: At the request of the Grand Nagus, Quark puts together a mission to rescue Quark's mother, who is in the hands of the Dominion.

episodes.title: Waltz
episodes.description: After being attacked by Cardassian forces, Sisko gets stranded with a very psychotic Gul Dukat, who was being transported to his trial. Meanwhile the crew of the Defiant races to rescue survivors.

episodes.title: Who Mourns for Morn?
episodes.description: A former patron of Quark's bequeaths everything to him.

episodes.title: Far Beyond the Stars
episodes.description: Captain Sisko has a full sensory vision of himself as an under-appreciated science fiction magazine writer in 1950s America.

episodes.title: One Little Ship
episodes.description: A Dominion attack on the Defiant endangers Dax, Bashir and O'Brien aboard the runabout U.S.S. Rubicon as they enter an anomaly that shrinks them to a very minute size. Unfortunately, they were being held stable by the Defiant within a tractor beam, which was discontinued during the attack.

episodes.title: Honor Among Thieves
episodes.description: Chief O'Brien goes undercover to infiltrate an Orion crime ring.

episodes.title: Change of Heart
episodes.description: Worf and Jadzia travel to the badlands to procure some information on the Dominion from a traitorous Cardassian. Bashir wants to engage in a holo-suite spy simulation, but O'Brien prefers to brush up on his tongo game after watching Jadzia lose to Quark.

episodes.title: Wrongs Darker than Death or Night
episodes.description: After receiving some disturbing information from Gul Dukat, Major Kira seeks Sisko's approval as Emissary to travel back in time to find out the truth about her mother.

episodes.title: Inquisition
episodes.description: Dr. Bashir's plans to attend a medical conference at a breezy resort are canceled when Starfleet Intelligence boards DS9, suspecting the doctor of treason.

episodes.title: In the Pale Moonlight
episodes.description: To save the Federation in a critical scheme, Sisko comes to realize that he must violate its fundamental principles to do so.

episodes.title: His Way
episodes.description: Odo is schooled in the ways of romance by a holographic programmed lounge singer.

episodes.title: The Reckoning
episodes.description: Spiritualists on Bajor summon Captain Sisko to the planet surface, where they show him a stone tablet with some unknown inscriptions. Once on DS9, the inscription reveals an ancient prophecy of coming disasters surrounding the wormhole, Bajor, and DS9, as those around him voice their uneasiness about Sisko being an Emissary for the planet.

episodes.title: Valiant
episodes.description: Jake and Nog's runabout come under attack from the Jem'Hadar, and are rescued by the Valiant, a ship manned by Red Squad, an elite group of young Starfleet cadets.

episodes.title: Profit and Lace
episodes.description: Quark's mother and the Grand Nagus show up on DS9, announcing a new amendment to the Bill of Opportunities he has instituted on the home planet of Ferenginar, and then follows up with the announcement, that, due to the new amendment, chaos has followed and he has been deposed.

episodes.title: Time's Orphan
episodes.description: The Chief's daughter gets caught in a time displacement and when they get her back, she is considerably older.

episodes.title: The Sound of Her Voice
episodes.description: As the Defiant races to a shipwrecked officer who is days away, the crew keeps in contact with her. Meanwhile, Jake follows Quark's latest scheme for story research.

episodes.title: Tears of the Prophets
episodes.description: When Sisko is picked to head up an attack on the Cardassian homeworld, the Prophets appear to him in a vision, warning him of impending doom if he leaves the station.

episodes.title: Image in the Sand
episodes.description: Having returned to Earth a couple of months ago, Sisko waits for the Prophets to instruct him on what to do next. When he receives one, he begins searching for the woman behind the face in the sand in his vision. Meanwhile, back on DS9, Kira deals with a promotion and handling the decisions surrounding her command, and finding herself wishing for the return of Sisko. And Worf deals with the loss of his wife, Jadzia Dax.

episodes.title: Shadows and Symbols
episodes.description: Ezri Dax joins Sisko and his family on his quest for the Orb of the Emissary. Colonel Kira mounts a blockade around a Bajoran moon, where the Romulan hospital is - along with thousands of Romulan missles (claimed to be defensive in purpose). Quark joins Bashir & O'Brien as they join Worf, aboard a Klingon warship as they mount a dangerous mission in Jadzia Dax's name in an effort to get her spirit into Sto-vo-kor, the Klingon's heaven.

episodes.title: Afterimage
episodes.description: Sisko tries to convince Ezri to stay in Starfleet and serve aboard DS9, as Ezri tries to get to know Jadzia's friends aboard the station, especially Worf. Meanwhile, Garak tries to deal with a severe bout of claustrophobia.

episodes.title: Take Me out to the Holosuite
episodes.description: A Vulcan captain challenges Sisko to a game of baseball.

episodes.title: Chrysalis
episodes.description: Dr. Bashir attempts to bring one of his genetically engineered friends out of the catatonic state she is in, and when he is successful, he begins to fall for her.

episodes.title: Treachery, Faith and the Great River
episodes.description: A Vorta offers Odo valuable information on the Dominion in exchange for asylum. Meanwhile, Nog tries his Ferengi knowledge as he wheels and deals for a valuable piece of equipment for Chief O'Brien.

episodes.title: Once More Unto the Breach
episodes.description: An aged Kor requests an opportunity to die with honor as a warrior.

episodes.title: The Siege of AR-558
episodes.description: Capt. Sisko and his away team volunteer to stay with a besieged unit at an isolated outpost.

episodes.title: Covenant
episodes.description: Kira is kidnapped and taken to Empok Nor by a member of a Pah'Wraith cult and discovers the group leader is Gul Dukat.

episodes.title: It's Only a Paper Moon
episodes.description: Severely depressed at his serious war wound, Nog retreats into Vic Fontaine's holosuite program while the singer tries to help him.

episodes.title: Prodigal Daughter
episodes.description: Ezri travels to her family home in search of Chief O'Brien who has discovered a murdered woman connected with the family and the Orion Syndicate.

episodes.title: The Emperor's New Cloak
episodes.description: Quark and Rom have to rescue Grand Nagus Zek who's being held captive in the alternate universe.

episodes.title: Field of Fire
episodes.description: To find an apparently untraceable murderer, Ezri Dax reluctantly calls up the residual consciousness remnant of her symbiont's past hidden psychopathic murderer host, Joran.

episodes.title: Chimera
episodes.description: After searching out and finding Odo, another changeling asks him to leave DS9 with him, even though the rest of the crew aren't convinced the new changeling is not part of the Founders.

episodes.title: Badda-Bing, Badda-Bang
episodes.description: When a programming glitch won't go away, mobsters take over Vic's and open for business, but the DS9 gang takes it personal when their favorite hangout is no longer their favorite, and they plan to get the new management ousted.

episodes.title: Inter Arma Enim Silent Leges
episodes.description: While making plans to attend a medical conference on the Romulan home world, Dr. Bashir is contacted by Sloan of Section 31 and recruited to determine the health of a high-ranking Romulan official. Things turn more desperate, though, when the ranking Starfleet admiral traveling with him, who knows about Section 31's interest in the conference mysteriously suffers a brain aneurysm after Dr. Bashir finds out that Sloan is traveling with the group, as well.

episodes.title: Penumbra
episodes.description: When the ship Worf was serving on is attacked in battle and all search efforts are abandoned, Ezri takes a runabout in search of him against Sisko's orders. Meanwhile, Sisko proposes to Kasidy Yates.

episodes.title: 'Til Death Do Us Part
episodes.description: The Prophets have told Sisko they do not approve of his impending marriage. Having been captured by the Breen, Ezri and Worf still don't know why the Breen would even bother to capture them. Some Cardassians are beginning to think their alliance with the Dominion was a grave mistake. Gul Dukat, disguised as a Bajoran, sets foot on DS9, and continues to unfurl his plan.

episodes.title: Strange Bedfellows
episodes.description: Kai Winn gets unknowingly involved with Gul Dukat, surgically altered to resemble a Bajoran, using the name 'Anjohl.' Tensions further escalate between Weyoun and Legate Damar, as the Dominion gather to sign a peace treaty with the Breen, which includes granting the Breen certain Cardassian territories. Having been held captive by the Dominion, Ezri and Worf try to escape from the Cardassian home world.

episodes.title: The Changing Face of Evil
episodes.description: After the Breen attack Earth, mixed emotions abound on DS9. Kai Winn reveals her true feelings regarding the Prophets to her spiritual guide, a Bajoran farmer named Anjohl, who is a surgically altered Dukat, and turns her back on them, and convinced by him to embrace the Pah Wraiths. On the home world of Cardassia, Legate Damar mounts a resistance to the Dominion.

episodes.title: When It Rains...
episodes.description: Kira gets sent behind Cardassian lines in an effort to train them in resistance fighting. When Dr. Bashir learns of the deadly disease Odo is infected with, he meets with resistance whilst trying to obtain Odo's medical records from Starfleet. Martok gets blindsided by Gowron when he arrives on DS9, announcing he has assumed command of the Klingon fleet.

episodes.title: Tacking into the Wind
episodes.description: Odo is affected by the disease threatening to eliminate his race more than he lets on, while Kira has to deal with the Cardassians' dislike of her. Even though General Martok sees Chancellor Gowron's move as part of a political vendetta, he does nothing about it. Worf suspects Gowron's military strategies are meant to humiliate Martok's command abilities, without thought the consequences have for Klingons as a whole. Meanwhile, O'Brien suggests to Bashir he announce he's found a cure to the Changelings' disease to lure someone from Section 31 to DS9.

episodes.title: Extreme Measures
episodes.description: Dr. Bashir and Chief O'Brien go to some pretty extreme measures to try and track down a cure for Odo.

episodes.title: The Dogs of War
episodes.description: Odo begins recovery from the deadly disease which Dr. Bashir tells him had been engineered by Section 31 in order to wipe out the Founders' entire race, A resistance mission goes bad for Kira and Garak, and they end up hiding in the basement of the house which Garak grew up in. They soon hear Legate Damar - who had been on their mission and was hiding with them - has just become a casualty of war. The Grand Nagus has chosen Quark to become his successor, upon his impending retirement on the pleasure planet, Risa.

episodes.title: What You Leave Behind
episodes.description: As the Dominion War comes to an end, Dukat goes to the Pah Wraiths to awaken them. Meanwhile the Dominion turn on the rebelling Cardassians, destroying them city by city. Will the Alliance prevail over the Dominion? Will Garak and the Rebellion stop them before the destruction of Cardassia? Will Sisko stop the Pah Wraiths from rising?

show.title: Star Trek: Voyager
show.description: Pulled to the far side of the galaxy, where the Federation is seventy-five years away at maximum warp speed, the crew of the Starfleet star-ship Voyager must forge a truce with a group of Maquis rebels in order to find a way home.

episodes.title: Caretaker
episodes.description: While pursuing the trail of Maquis rebels, a newly commissioned Starfleet ship gets pulled to the far side of the galaxy.

episodes.title: Parallax
episodes.description: Tensions rise between the merged Starfleet and Maquis crews when they discover another ship caught within a quantum singularity, only to find there's more to the ship than it seems.

episodes.title: Time and Again
episodes.description: The Voyager crew discovers a planet which recently suffered a horrific catastrophe. Upon investigation, Janeway and Paris are sent back in time before the disaster and are faced with the decision of whether to try to stop it.

episodes.title: Phage
episodes.description: Searching to replenish their dilithium supplies, Voyager encounters the Vidiians who assault other races for their organs. Neelix is attacked and his lungs taken. Now it's a race against time to retrieve the stolen lungs and save his life.

episodes.title: The Cloud
episodes.description: Voyager becomes trapped in a strange nebula when the crew searches for a new power source for the ship.

episodes.title: Eye of the Needle
episodes.description: When the Voyager crew encounters a wormhole and makes contact with a ship on the other side, it raises the crew's hopes of getting back to Earth.

episodes.title: Ex Post Facto
episodes.description: Tuvok plays detective when Paris is wrongfully convicted by an alien race of murder.

episodes.title: Emanations
episodes.description: When the crew finds a mysterious alien burial ground within an asteroid, a unknown phenomenon that teleports the bodies suddenly transports Kim to another planet where an alien race believes he is a being from the afterlife.

episodes.title: Prime Factors
episodes.description: The crew encounters a hedonistic alien race with the ability to travel through the galaxy at will -- an ability that may be the key to Voyager's returning home.

episodes.title: State of Flux
episodes.description: A fatal disaster aboard a Kazon ship reveals mishandled Federation technology at its heart, which indicates a traitor aboard Voyager.

episodes.title: Heroes and Demons
episodes.description: When Harry disappears during his Beowulf holonovel, Chakotay and Tuvok, sent to investigate, disappear as well. Not wanting to lose anymore crewmembers, the Doctor's transferred to the holodeck to investigate.

episodes.title: Cathexis
episodes.description: An encounter with a peculiar nebula suddenly leaves Chakotay brain dead and unconscious. The crew is left with a mysterious but powerful force of energy onboard that can take over the minds of the crew members.

episodes.title: Faces
episodes.description: In an attempt to develop a cure for the Phage, a Vidiian doctor captures Torres and splits her into her 2 halves, one human - the other, Klingon.

episodes.title: Jetrel
episodes.description: Neelix is diagnosed with a fatal illness by a Haakonian named Jetrel. The same man who'd developed a doomsday weapon which destroyed a Talaxian moon and killed Neelix's family.

episodes.title: Learning Curve
episodes.description: As Neelix's cooking sickens Voyager itself, Tuvok runs the four most problematic Maquis malcontents through a Starfleet-style boot camp.

episodes.title: The 37's
episodes.description: The Voyager crew discovers several people who were abducted during 1937, including Amelia Earhart, cryogenically frozen on a distant planet.

episodes.title: Initiations
episodes.description: Chakotay is captured by a young Kazon who is undergoing a manhood ritual.

episodes.title: Projections
episodes.description: The Doctor tries to determine what is real and what is not when he is activated due to what appears to be a ship-wide emergency.

episodes.title: Elogium
episodes.description: The Voyager encounters a swarm of mysterious life forms that has a strange effect on the ship's key operating system and whose presence accelerates Kes' reproductive cycle.

episodes.title: Non Sequitur
episodes.description: Harry Kim wakes up in San Francisco having never been assigned to Voyager which Starfleet considers lost.

episodes.title: Twisted
episodes.description: A strange spatial distortion afflicts the ship and has the entire crew literally lost on their own ship.

episodes.title: Parturition
episodes.description: After a disagreement over Kes, Neelix and Tom Paris are trapped together on an alien planet and must work together so that they and their alien baby ward can survive.

episodes.title: Persistence of Vision
episodes.description: The Voyager crew enters a new region of space and begins to see hallucinations. The Captain sees her holonovel characters come to life.

episodes.title: Tattoo
episodes.description: Finding a familiar cultural symbol on an away mission, Chakotay connects with an experience he had as a child and tries to contact his spirit people.

episodes.title: Cold Fire
episodes.description: The Caretaker's remains resonate, which might well mean that its mate is nearby. The trail leads to a space colony of Ocampa with psychokinetic powers.

episodes.title: Maneuvers
episodes.description: After the Kazon steal some Federation technology Chakotay goes after them on his own and is captured.

episodes.title: Resistance
episodes.description: Disguised while on an away mission Captain Janeway is rescued by a man who thinks that she is his daughter.

episodes.title: Prototype
episodes.description: B'Elanna gives aid to a failing automated device found adrift in space. After the repairs, the device recalls what its purpose was - and carries it out.

episodes.title: Alliances
episodes.description: Janeway tries to make an alliance with a Kazon sect for their own protection and so they can continue their journey through the Delta Quadrant.

episodes.title: Threshold
episodes.description: Tom's attempt to cross the time warp threshold and make a name for himself results in rapid physical mutation.

episodes.title: Meld
episodes.description: Tuvok mind-melds with a murderous Maquis crewman to better understand the roots of serial killing, losing control of himself in the process.

episodes.title: Dreadnought
episodes.description: B'Elanna confronts her Maquis past when Voyager discovers a Cardassian super-weapon in the Delta Quadrant with artificial intelligence that B'Elanna once modified.

episodes.title: Death Wish
episodes.description: As Voyager's captain, Janeway conducts a hearing for asylum tied to a suicidal Q's right to die.

episodes.title: Lifesigns
episodes.description: The Doctor saves a Vidiian dying from the Phage by placing her consciousness in a holographic body, and then begins to fall in love with her.

episodes.title: Investigations
episodes.description: Tom Paris leaves Voyager and joins a Talaxian space convoy.

episodes.title: Deadlock
episodes.description: A schism duplicates everything in Voyager; except the antimatter, which both ships share. As one ship rips apart, the other comes under attack from organ-harvesting Vidiians.

episodes.title: Innocence
episodes.description: Tuvok crashes on a planet where he finds some children who know that they are all going to die.

episodes.title: The Thaw
episodes.description: Voyager finds a group of people in connected stasis chambers where something has gone terribly wrong.

episodes.title: Tuvix
episodes.description: Transporter trouble merges Tuvok and Neelix into one, creating Tuvix.

episodes.title: Resolutions
episodes.description: Captain Janeway and Chakotay contract an incurable virus and they can only survive if they stay behind together on a planet which negates the effects of the disease.

episodes.title: Basics, Part I
episodes.description: Seska knows Voyager, and her Kazon cohorts want it, so the Voyager crew wonders what to make of her distress call announcing the birth of Chakotay's son.

episodes.title: Basics, Part II
episodes.description: With almost the entire crew of Voyager marooned on a desolate planet by the Kazon, Tom Paris heads out to fetch help while Lon Suder and the Doctor, still on Voyager, try to assist.

episodes.title: Flashback
episodes.description: Captain Janeway participates in a mind meld with Tuvok, who relives his experiences on the U.S.S. Excelsior under the command of Captain Sulu at the time of Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country (1991).

episodes.title: The Chute
episodes.description: Convicted of a crime they didn't commit, Harry and Tom wind up in an unsupervised, crowded prison, a hellhole where implants ramp up everyone's aggression.

episodes.title: The Swarm
episodes.description: Voyager is attacked by swarms of tiny spaceships which attach themselves to Voyager's hull. The Doctor is losing his memory and Torres activates the Jupiter Station diagnostic program run by a familiar hologram.

episodes.title: False Profits
episodes.description: Voyager comes across a pair of Alpha Quadrant Ferengis who have set themselves up as gods on a primitive planet. Voyager wants to end their reign and use the nearby wormhole to return home.

episodes.title: Remember
episodes.description: Lieutenant Torres starts having vivid dreams about another life, another love, and another planet.

episodes.title: Sacred Ground
episodes.description: After Kes is injured by an energy field on a planet's sacred ground, Janeway must undergo a spiritual quest in order to save her life.

episodes.title: Future's End
episodes.description: A timeship from the future who tries to stop Voyager gets thrown with Voyager into the twentieth century. His timeship is found in 1967 and Voyager discovers that a company that has benefited from its technology exists in 1996.

episodes.title: Future's End: Part II
episodes.description: As the Voyager crew pit their 24th century technology against Starling's stolen 29th century technology, Chakotay and Torres fall into the hands of paranoid white supremacists.

episodes.title: Warlord
episodes.description: A dying warlord, determined to retake his home planet, takes over Kes's body.

episodes.title: The Q and the Grey
episodes.description: Due to the death of the Q in their last encounter with Voyager, a Civil War has broken out among the Q continuum. A new Q needs to be produced and the mischievous Q known to the USS Enterprise has chosen Janeway as his mate.

episodes.title: Macrocosm
episodes.description: After returning from a first contact mission, Janeway, Neelix and the Doctor must retake Voyager from an infestation of microorganisms that grow to an alarming size.

episodes.title: Fair Trade
episodes.description: Voyager heads into a section of space that Neelix has no knowledge of, so he tries to obtain a map of it from a less-than-reputable friend.

episodes.title: Alter Ego
episodes.description: Ens. Kim and Lt. Tuvok become rivals in love over what at first seems to be a holodeck character.

episodes.title: Coda
episodes.description: Chakotay and Janeway crash on a planet and are stuck in a time loop where Janeway dies.

episodes.title: Blood Fever
episodes.description: Ensign Vorik's attempt to make B'Elanna his mate during Pon farr biochemically destabilizes B'Elanna, heightening her own aggressive emotions towards taking a mate.

episodes.title: Unity
episodes.description: Chakotay finds a planet of unassimilated Borg drones from all over the galaxy.

episodes.title: Darkling
episodes.description: As Kes develops a relationship with a Mikhal Traveler, a member of Voyager's crew develops a dangerously ruthless split personality with a fixation on Kes.

episodes.title: Rise
episodes.description: While helping a planet being bombarded by asteroids, Neelix and Tuvok get trapped on the surface, where Tuvok's negative attitude gets the better of Neelix's nerves.

episodes.title: Favorite Son
episodes.description: Ensign Kim's DNA changes, bringing with it memories of the region while a planet of alien women claim him as a favorite son returning home to mate.

episodes.title: Before and After
episodes.description: On her deathbed, Kes relives her life, jumping backwards in spurts of time towards birth, gaining knowledge as to why as she goes.

episodes.title: Real Life
episodes.description: As Captain Janeway leads an investigation into an unheard of space phenomenon, B'Elanna tweaks the Doctor's all too sugary creation of a holographic family towards "real life."

episodes.title: Distant Origin
episodes.description: A superior race, descended from Earth dinosaurs, discovers Voyager, but living proof of the controversial Distant Origin Theory goes against widespread doctrine.

episodes.title: Displaced
episodes.description: Voyager's crew is being replaced by strangers one by one and the replacements don't know why they are there.

episodes.title: Worst Case Scenario
episodes.description: B'Elanna's discovery of a holonovel projecting a Maquis takeover of Voyager enthralls the crew, but a hidden edit could kill its mystery author.

episodes.title: Scorpion
episodes.description: About to enter Borg space, Voyager finds a threat so devastating that even the Borg cannot deal with it.

episodes.title: Scorpion, Part II
episodes.description: Voyager finds a solution to combat the invader of Borg space. All Captain Janeway asks is free passage through their territory and Voyager will share their knowledge.

episodes.title: The Gift
episodes.description: As the crew works to remove impeding Borg technologies from Voyager, their Borg guest wants out while a crew member's telekinetic abilities become too big to contain.

episodes.title: Day of Honor
episodes.description: Needy alien refugees, who look upon Voyager's generosity as stingy, put Torres and Paris in a life-threatening situation during a crossroads in their relationship.

episodes.title: Nemesis
episodes.description: Shot down by crossfire, Chakotay bonds with one faction in the midst of a war.

episodes.title: Revulsion
episodes.description: Amidst promotions, added duties and shifts in relationships, Voyager responds to a distress call from a hologram, one who proves himself dangerously unsafe to be around.

episodes.title: The Raven
episodes.description: PTSD strikes Seven of Nine, causing frightening visions and prompting her, under a panic attack, to seek the Borg Collective where no Borg exist.

episodes.title: Scientific Method
episodes.description: A string of bizarre illnesses afflicts the Voyager crew. The Doctor and Seven of Nine uncover a team of alien researchers existing out of phase performing medical experiments on the ship's crew.

episodes.title: Year of Hell
episodes.description: Voyager comes across a Krenim timeship that's wiping whole species from existence to change the existing timeline.

episodes.title: Year of Hell, Part II
episodes.description: A year after Voyager encounters the Krenim time ship, a badly damaged Voyager with a skeleton crew leads an armada of interplanetary ships against them.

episodes.title: Random Thoughts
episodes.description: A telepathic race arrests B'Elanna for thinking violent thoughts that have begun to infect their peacefully enlightened, virtually crime-free society.

episodes.title: Concerning Flight
episodes.description: After aliens raid Voyager, Janeway discovers her Leonardo holodeck character living independently at a trading post under the patronage of a shameless "prince" of thieves.

episodes.title: Mortal Coil
episodes.description: Thanks to Seven of Nine, Neelix returns from the dead, but his lack of a glimpse of the afterlife brings about a severe crisis of faith.

episodes.title: Waking Moments
episodes.description: Nightmares herald the presence of an alien race who've mastered the dream state. Chakotay's experience in lucid dreaming seems Voyager's best hope of escaping a shared dream entrapment.

episodes.title: Message in a Bottle
episodes.description: Using an alien communications net, Voyager sends their Doctor to the Federation ship USS Prometheus only to find that it has been taken over by Romulans.

episodes.title: Hunters
episodes.description: Voyager starts to receive news from home both good and bad. They also encounter the Hirogen race who only live to hunt and have their sights on Voyager.

episodes.title: Prey
episodes.description: Helping a wounded Hirogen, Janeway finds that their prey has boarded Voyager, a member of Species 8472.

episodes.title: Retrospect
episodes.description: Seven of Nine claims to have been assaulted by the arms trader who just sold new technology to Voyager.

episodes.title: The Killing Game
episodes.description: After Voyager is captured by the Hirogen, the ship is turned into a massive holodeck so that the aliens can hunt members of the crew who have been fitted with new identities in various scenarios based upon Earth and Federation history.

episodes.title: The Killing Game, Part II
episodes.description: Janeway seeks to retake her ship and crew from the Hirogens.

episodes.title: Vis À Vis
episodes.description: Tom Paris befriends an amiable alien, unaware he's a serial form-exchanger who switches appearances and troubles with others without permission.

episodes.title: The Omega Directive
episodes.description: Detection of an Omega particle puts all other priorities and Starfleet directives on hold. Janeway is duty-bound to destroy that particle above all else, but Seven objects.

episodes.title: Unforgettable
episodes.description: An alien woman from a closed world seeks asylum aboard Voyager, claiming she's been there before and that she and Chakotay were lovers, but no one remembers her.

episodes.title: Living Witness
episodes.description: The Doctor awakens in the museum of an alien culture seven hundred years in the future, where Voyager is thought to have been a passing warship full of cold-blooded killers.

episodes.title: Demon
episodes.description: Critically low on energy, Voyager limps to a hellish Y-class "Demon" planet for much needed deuterium. Harry and Tom beam down and make accidental contact with a gooey life form.

episodes.title: One
episodes.description: Travel through a toxic nebula puts nearly all the Voyager crew in stasis, restricts the Doctor to sickbay, degrades the ship's systems and leaves Seven solely in charge.

episodes.title: Hope and Fear
episodes.description: A tough coded message from Starfleet with a promise of home and a helpful alien adept at cracking language patterns. The coincidence seems too convenient for Capt. Janeway.

episodes.title: Night
episodes.description: Passing through a vast starless void, monotony hits the crew hard until a darkness species attacks, mistaking Voyager as an ally of a poisonous garbage freighter.

episodes.title: Drone
episodes.description: Voyager investigates the birth of a nebula. Unfortunately, its intense blast wave catches an away mission shuttle, causing emergency beam out transporter signals to fuse the Doctor's mobile emitter with Seven's nanoprobes. The mobile emitter subsequently starts assimilating a science lab and assaults a crew member to create a new Borg drone built upon the emitter's twenty-ninth century technology.

episodes.title: Extreme Risk
episodes.description: B'Elanna Torres secretly participates in several dangerous holodeck programs. The Voyager crew works around the clock to build the Delta Flyer, hoping to beat the Malon in retrieving a lost probe from the atmosphere of a gas giant.

episodes.title: In the Flesh
episodes.description: The Voyager crew discovers Species 8472 training to pose as human beings in a recreation of Starfleet Headquarters, a prelude to infiltration.

episodes.title: Once Upon a Time
episodes.description: Long traumatized by the loss of his own family, Neelix balks at telling Naomi that her mother and others have gone missing on an away mission.

episodes.title: Timeless
episodes.description: A miscalculation by Ensign Kim causes a fatal crash during Voyager's first test with slipstream travel. Fifteen years in the future, survivors Chakotay, Kim and The Doctor attempt to send a message back in time to prevent the tragedy.

episodes.title: Infinite Regress
episodes.description: Voyager comes in contact with Borg technology which causes Seven of Nine to display multiple personalities.

episodes.title: Nothing Human
episodes.description: When an alien parasitically latches onto B'Elanna for survival, the Doctor calls upon a holographic Cardassian doctor for assistance, unaware he's a war criminal, thereby creating an ethical quandary.

episodes.title: Thirty Days
episodes.description: In a letter to his father, Tom Paris tells the story of the events leading up to his demotion to Ensign and sentence to thirty days in Voyager's brig.

episodes.title: Counterpoint
episodes.description: Voyager passes through a sector of space controlled by a race that is deeply suspicious of telepathic lifeforms. The presence of Tuvok and other telepaths forces the Voyager crew to develop a novel approach in order to pass through safely.

episodes.title: Latent Image
episodes.description: The Doctor discovers a profoundly personal mystery when evidence of performing surgery on Ens. Kim eighteen months ago arises - for which the Doctor has no memory.

episodes.title: Bride of Chaotica!
episodes.description: The Voyager crew encounters photonic life forms that mistake warmongering characters as real in Tom Paris' far-fetched "Captain Proton" holodeck program.

episodes.title: Gravity
episodes.description: Stuck on a planet within a spatial "sinkhole," Tom pressures Tuvok to take an alien woman who fancies him for his own.

episodes.title: Bliss
episodes.description: The Voyager crew discovers what seems to be a wormhole leading to the Alpha Quadrant and home. Images of Earth and letters from home elates the crew of Voyager. Seven, and others, however, are skeptical of this seeming deliverance.

episodes.title: Dark Frontier
episodes.description: Aboard the Delta Flyer, Janeway leads Tuvok, Paris and the Doctor on a rescue mission to retrieve Seven from the Borg Queen. whose treatment of Seven is markedly atypical.

episodes.title: The Disease
episodes.description: Voyager encounters a group of xenophobic nomads, in space for 400 years, with serious ship-wide malfunctions. The offer to help leads to serious consequences.

episodes.title: Course: Oblivion
episodes.description: A slight respite seems to be in order but some mysterious force is affecting the very fabric of Voyager itself. To solve the mystery this crew must retrace their steps to see what went wrong.

episodes.title: The Fight
episodes.description: As unseen aliens adjust his neural pathways, Chakotay recalls both boxing at the academy under groundskeeper Boothby's management and watching after his "crazy old" grandfather.

episodes.title: Think Tank
episodes.description: As a relentless bounty hunter race closes in on Voyager, a sly alien think tank offers to devise a solution in exchange for a particular member of Voyager's crew joining them.

episodes.title: Juggernaut
episodes.description: Voyager must prevent a toxic waste freighter from exploding, lethally contaminating a vast sector of space. Unfortunately, there could be an alien boogeyman aboard the heavily irradiated ship.

episodes.title: Someone to Watch Over Me
episodes.description: As The Doctor guides Seven into the unfamiliar social realm of dating, Ambassador Neelix suffers an alien monk who overindulges.
Capt. Janeway recalls her ancestor, Shannon O'Donnell, with great reverence, but historical records don't back up the family story.

episodes.title: Relativity
episodes.description: Federation time ship Capt Braxton pulls Seven out of her time to help identify and destroy a bomb planted aboard Voyager.

episodes.title: Warhead
episodes.description: An alien weapon that possesses artificial intelligence links with the EMH program and begins to terrorize the crew.

episodes.title: Equinox
episodes.description: Voyager discovers another Federation starship in the Delta Quadrant, one that's had a rougher time getting home, on its last legs, and harboring a dark secret.

episodes.title: Equinox, Part II
episodes.description: While trying to run down the Equinox and retrieve its captain, Chakotay fears Janeway becoming equally as unethical and corrupt, challenging his loyalty.

episodes.title: Survival Instinct
episodes.description: A forgotten past decision confronts Seven of Nine when she meets three ex-Borg former shipmates permanently mind-linked to one another.

episodes.title: Barge of the Dead
episodes.description: A brutal experience aboard a shuttle puts B'Elanna in touch with the Klingon afterlife, where the Barge of the Dead steers her towards Klingon hell along with her mother.

episodes.title: Tinker Tenor Doctor Spy
episodes.description: An alien race, sizing up Voyager for a raid, taps into The Doctor's cognitive subroutines to make him their spy, unaware they're watching The Doctor's new daydreaming program.

episodes.title: Alice
episodes.description: Voyager takes on a "haunted" hot rod alien spacecraft with a possessive artificial intelligence that jealously bonds with Tom Paris.

episodes.title: Riddles
episodes.description: Sudden contact with a cloaked and extremely xenophobic race leaves Tuvok brain damaged. Neelix puts himself in charge of his rehabilitation.

episodes.title: Dragon's Teeth
episodes.description: An encounter with aliens in a subspace corridor leads Voyager to take refuge on a radioactive planet with remnants of its civilization tucked underground in stasis chambers.

episodes.title: One Small Step
episodes.description: Voyager crosses paths with a rare spatial anomaly that swallowed an Earth ship orbiting Mars in 2032 (a discovery that calls for an away mission).

episodes.title: The Voyager Conspiracy
episodes.description: Modifying her alcove to process several months of gathered data at a time turns Seven into a rampant conspiracy theorist. Meanwhile, Janeway deals with an alien scientist developing catapult technology.

episodes.title: Pathfinder
episodes.description: On Earth, Barclay uses holograms to formulate a plan to open communications with Voyager.

episodes.title: Fair Haven
episodes.description: Capt. Janeway falls for an Irish barman character she modifies within Tom's holodeck Irish village recreational getaway for the crew called Fair Haven.

episodes.title: Blink of an Eye
episodes.description: Voyager becomes trapped in orbit of a planet where time passes rapidly, days within seconds, and enters the mythos of its indigenous people.

episodes.title: Virtuoso
episodes.description: The Doctor's singing talent is so appreciated by an alien species that he considers resigning his commission and staying on with his millions of adoring fans.

episodes.title: Memorial
episodes.description: Members of an away mission start dreaming about a species they have never seen before who are in a gruesome battle on an unknown planet.

episodes.title: Tsunkatse
episodes.description: Seven of Nine and Tuvok are enslaved while on an away mission, with Seven forced to fight in gladiatorial competitions to the death.

episodes.title: Collective
episodes.description: Several Borg children abduct Chakotay, Kim, Neelix and Paris.

episodes.title: Spirit Folk
episodes.description: For the holographic inhabitants of Fair Haven, unworldly actions from Voyager personnel fit only one explanation - they're faerie folk.

episodes.title: Ashes to Ashes
episodes.description: Voyager receives a former crewman, deceased, resurrected, genetically altered, unrecognizable, and glad to be "home." Meanwhile, looking after the Borg children exasperates Seven of Nine.

episodes.title: Child's Play
episodes.description: When Icheb's parents are located, Seven of Nine should be overjoyed, but instead does not believe their tale of Icheb's original assimilation.

episodes.title: Good Shepherd
episodes.description: Three errant crewmen. What's Janeway to do? Take 'em on an away mission to see their colors true.

episodes.title: Live Fast and Prosper
episodes.description: A trio of impostors give Voyager, Janeway, Tuvok, Chakotay and the Federation a bad name.

episodes.title: Muse
episodes.description: An alien playwright discovers B'Elanna Torres, crash landed in the Delta Flier, and uses her and her logs as story material to please his patron.

episodes.title: Fury
episodes.description: An incensed Kes returns to Voyager to travel back in time and abduct her younger self, inadvertently causing younger Tuvok to experience precognitive hallucinations.

episodes.title: Life Line
episodes.description: The Doctor gets himself transmitted back to Federation space to treat his mortally ailing creator, Dr. Lewis Zimmerman. A clash of egos ensues.

episodes.title: The Haunting of Deck Twelve
episodes.description: Neelix engages the four ex-Borg children in a ghost story to keep them calm during a ship-wide power shutdown.

episodes.title: Unimatrix Zero
episodes.description: Simultaneously, as Voyager nears an alien outpost decimated by the Borg, Seven of Nine begins to dream vividly of an idyllic sanctuary where a few Borg can gather subconsciously - Unimatrix Zero.

episodes.title: Unimatrix Zero Part II
episodes.description: Although captured, Capt. Janeway squares off with the Borg Queen after successfully introducing the Doctor's pathogen to the Borg Central Plexus. Supply the cure or watch thousands die.

episodes.title: Imperfection
episodes.description: Seven of Nine's life is threatened when her cortical implants begin to degrade. Icheb wants to help her, but his proposition is very risky.

episodes.title: Drive
episodes.description: Tom's sudden entry in an alien spacecraft race throws a wrench into B'Elanna's labored plans for a romantic holodeck getaway for two, threatening their relationship.

episodes.title: Repression
episodes.description: Security officer Tuvok investigates a strange series of attacks on Voyager directed at the former Maquis members.

episodes.title: Critical Care
episodes.description: Stolen and sold off, The Doctor winds up enslaved at an alien hospital, where social status strictly defines the quality of provided health care.

episodes.title: Inside Man
episodes.description: Direct from Starfleet a hologram of Barclay arrives with instructions to get Voyager home within three days. The Doctor suspects that there is something wrong with the hologram.

episodes.title: Body and Soul
episodes.description: To circumvent The Doctor's obliteration by photon-hating humanoids, Seven secretly becomes his bodily host. In turn, The Doctor's personality dominates.

episodes.title: Nightingale
episodes.description: When the Delta Flyer comes to the aid of a medical transport, Harry Kim gets his first command.

episodes.title: Flesh and Blood
episodes.description: Free from their pursuers, the leader of the holograms decides to continue the crusade against the organics in order to liberate all holograms, everywhere. The Doctor finally realises what he had done and comes up with a plan to redeem himself.

episodes.title: Shattered
episodes.description: Voyager encounters an energy field which leaves each section - and its crew - existing in a different time period.

episodes.title: Lineage
episodes.description: Tom and B'Elanna are overjoyed about their coming child; however, B'Elanna soon starts to have unpleasant flashbacks about her difficult childhood.

episodes.title: Repentance
episodes.description: Voyager rescues a prison warden and a set of prisoners that are scheduled to be executed testing their own ethical beliefs.

episodes.title: Prophecy
episodes.description: Voyager finds a multi-generational Klingon ship that left the Alpha Quadrant more than 100 years before. When they hear of B'Elanna's child, they claim it as their savior.

episodes.title: The Void
episodes.description: Voyager slips into a pocket of subspace where many other ships are trapped and must steal from each other to survive. Only with the help of other star ships can they all escape the void.

episodes.title: Workforce
episodes.description: Almost the entire Voyager crew has been abducted and brainwashed to serve as workers in a severely short-handed industrial alien society.

episodes.title: Workforce, Part II
episodes.description: While B'Elanna's memories slowly return aboard Voyager, Chakotay struggles to maintain his identity against the Quarren's Division 6.

episodes.title: Human Error
episodes.description: Using the holodeck, Seven of Nine is trying to perfect her social skills to the point of becoming an obsession.

episodes.title: Q2
episodes.description: When Q finds his rebellious son too much to handle, he brings him to Voyager in the hope that Captain Janeway can teach him responsibility and compassion.

episodes.title: Author, Author
episodes.description: The Doctor writes and publishes an incendiary holonovel that defames the crew, Paris' tampering offends the author, and The Doctor's rights come into question.

episodes.title: Friendship One
episodes.description: For the first time in seven years, Voyager gets a mission from Starfleet Command: retrieve the 21st century probe Friendship One from a nearby planet.

episodes.title: Natural Law
episodes.description: Chakotay and Seven of Nine's shuttle is crippled by an energy field and they crash on a planet inhabited by a primitive species.

episodes.title: Homestead
episodes.description: Voyager finds a colony of Talaxians far from their home planet. When Neelix begins to bond with them, he makes a major decision.

episodes.title: Renaissance Man
episodes.description: The Doctor abducts and impersonates various members of the crew when the Captain is kidnapped.

episodes.title: Endgame
episodes.description: Having long since made it home, an aged Admiral Janeway breaks Starfleet directives and temporal laws to take a last stab at an old enemy and shorten Voyager's journey home.

show.title: Enterprise
show.description: A century before Captain Kirk's five-year mission, Jonathan Archer captains the United Earth ship Enterprise during the early years of Starfleet, leading up to the Earth-Romulan War and the formation of the Federation.

episodes.title: Broken Bow, Part 1
episodes.description: In the mid-22nd century, the Earth ship Enterprise is launched under the command of Captain Jonathan Archer. When the crew rescues an alien from a crashed spaceship, Earth gets its first look at the alien's race - the Klingons. Archer and his crew must walk a fine line as they attempt to communicate with the Klingon pilot, whose language is completely unknown, and whose homeworld wants him back. Is this the beginning of friendship...or interstellar war?

episodes.title: Broken Bow, Part 2
episodes.description: Captain Jonathan Archer, T'Pol and Trip meet Sarin and she explains that Klaang is a courier, bringing an important message from her to the leaders of the Klingons in Kronos about rebels Suliban that intend to promote the Temporal Cold War among the Klingons. Archer feels the need of rescuing Klaang and travels to the Suliban mother-ship with Trip to bring the Klingon back to Enterprise. T'Pol seems to understand that loyalty is an emotion that cannot be avoided by humans.

episodes.title: Fight or Flight
episodes.description: Captain Archer wants to convert curiosity into deeds and decides to enter a ship floating in space. Hoshi has trouble adjusting to life on Enterprise.

episodes.title: Strange New World
episodes.description: Archer sends an away team to a habitable, luscious planet for observation. But when a storm occurs, the team begins to experience paranoid delusions.

episodes.title: Unexpected
episodes.description: After helping to repair the warp drive on board of a Xyrillian ship, Trip notices a strange bulging on his arm.

episodes.title: Terra Nova
episodes.description: Enterprise tries to find out what happened on Terra Nova, the first colonization attempt outside Earth's solar system.

episodes.title: The Andorian Incident
episodes.description: Archer, Trip and T'Pol are captured by the Andorians at a Vulcan monastery on P'Jem. They believe that the monastery is being used to spy on Andoria.

episodes.title: Breaking the Ice
episodes.description: Enterprise discovers a comet which contains the very rare element eisilium. Then unexpectedly a Vulcan ship arrives. Captain Vanik tells they're interested in human behavior.

episodes.title: Civilization
episodes.description: T'Pol finds unusual neutrino readings on a planet with a preindustrial society.

episodes.title: Fortunate Son
episodes.description: Enterprise is sent to help the freighter Fortunate after an attack. However, its first officer, Ryan, is hiding something.

episodes.title: Cold Front
episodes.description: Enterprise has a group of aliens watching a stellar phenomenon on board. When the ship is miraculously saved from blowing up, crewman Daniels has an important message for Archer.

episodes.title: Silent Enemy
episodes.description: After an attack by a mysterious ship, Archers orders Enterprise's return to Jupiter to install phase cannons; Hoshi makes plans for Malcolm's birthday.

episodes.title: Dear Doctor
episodes.description: Phlox is asked to save the Valakians from annihilation by disease. However, he discovers something unusual about the Menk, another humanoid race on the planet.

episodes.title: Sleeping Dogs
episodes.description: Enterprise tries to rescue a Klingon ship from sinking into a gas giant.

episodes.title: Shadows of P'Jem
episodes.description: T'Pol is being recalled because of Enterprise's involvement in the destruction of the P'Jem sanctuary. She and Captain Archer are later kidnapped while visiting the planet Coridan.

episodes.title: Shuttlepod One
episodes.description: While returning to Enterprise in Shuttlepod One, Trip and Reed see apparent evidence that the ship has been destroyed. With only days of oxygen left, they must find a way to survive long enough for rescue.

episodes.title: Fusion
episodes.description: When Enterprise encounters a ship of Vulcan pilgrims, T'Pol is convinced by one of them to perform a Vulcan mind meld.

episodes.title: Rogue Planet
episodes.description: Lieutenant Reed discovers a rogue planet, which has broken out of orbit and therefore is devoid of any light. Life is still possible in some places because heat is bubbling up from under the surface, but T'Pol doesn't detect any humanoid life. Further scans however give a strange energy reading which seems to be coming from a ship on the surface. After the crew has landed, they encounter the Eska. The Eska come from another planet and they say they are hunting for the drayjin, an animal considered a delicacy. When captain Jonathan Archer tries to sleep on the planet, he hears a voice calling him by his name. A human female is wandering in the forest. Somehow he seems to know her.

episodes.title: Acquisition
episodes.description: Almost the entire crew is left unconscious when four Ferengi pirates raid Enterprise. A still conscious Trip is the only one who can get rid of them.

episodes.title: Oasis
episodes.description: The crew of Enterprise searches for a seemingly abandoned ship on a desert planet.

episodes.title: Detained
episodes.description: Archer and Mayweather are captured by the Tandarans and placed in a Suliban internment camp.

episodes.title: Vox Sola
episodes.description: A fibrous, web-like alien creature comes aboard the ship and several of the crew becomes entangled in it including Archer and Trip, and it seems Hoshi is the only one who can try to communicate with the creature.

episodes.title: Fallen Hero
episodes.description: Enterprise is planning a trip to the relaxation planet Risa, when it gets an urgent request from the Vulcan High Command. They must pick up ambassador V'Lar who has fallen in disgrace. Apparently she misused her position during negotiations on the planet Mazar and has been evicted. After Enterprise picked up V'Lar and is on its way for a meeting with the Vulcan warship Sh'Ran, suddenly a Mazarite ship appears. They want V'Lar for further interrogating. When captain Archer wants to discuss it first with Starfleet Command, they open fire.

episodes.title: Desert Crossing
episodes.description: Enterprise is for the second time on its way to Risa when yet again another urgent matter comes up: a distress call. It comes from a small vessel. The owner, Zobral, is extremely happy with the help from Enterprise and invites Captain Archer to his home world for a good meal and a game of Geskana. When Archer and Trip have landed on the desert planet, Enterprise gets a message from the Torothan Chancellor Trelit. He says Zobral isn't as nice a man as captain Archer thinks.

episodes.title: Two Days and Two Nights
episodes.description: The members of the Enterprise crew are faced with various misadventures and challenges while taking a two day break from their duties on the planet of Risa.

episodes.title: Shockwave, Part I
episodes.description: Enterprise discovers a mining colony of the Paraagans. The crew gets an invitation for a meeting on the surface and a shuttle pod tries to break through the atmosphere. All of a sudden just under the shuttle a giant explosion begins and scorches the earth beneath. All 3600 colonists are reported dead. After examination, Enterprise finds out plasma leaking from the pod's vents ignited tetrazine in the atmosphere. Lieutenant Reed, however, ensures he closed the plasma vents before the shuttle went of. After conversations with admiral Forrest of Starfleet Command, Captain Archer learns that Enterprise's mission is canceled and they must return home, not to return to space for another ten or twenty years. When the ship has altered course, crewman Daniels, a time traveler, pays a visit to captain Archer.

episodes.title: Shockwave, Part II
episodes.description: Captain Archer and temporal agent Daniels have been stranded in the 31st century. In a library they investigate the damage to the time line and try to find way a to get Archer back in his own century. Meanwhile Silik the Suliban leader is trying his utmost to find the whereabouts of Archer and he is willing to go far for the answer. But the crew of Enterprise has plans of their own. Trip finds a way to use the com system and is able to speak with Reed. Together they try to contact other crew members and make plans to purge Enterprise of the Sulibans.

episodes.title: Carbon Creek
episodes.description: On the first anniversary of her assignment to Enterprise, T'Pol tells Archer and Trip about the first contact between humans and Vulcans, which involves three Vulcans becoming stranded in the town of Carbon Creek, Pennsylvania in 1957.

episodes.title: Minefield
episodes.description: The safety of Enterprise rests on Reed's shoulders when the ship becomes trapped in a Romulan minefield and Romulan ships are closing in on them.

episodes.title: Dead Stop
episodes.description: Enterprise seeks repairs from their encounters with the Romulans, where they stop at a desolate but idyllic repair station. But all is not what it seems when Mayweather is suddenly found dead.

episodes.title: A Night in Sickbay
episodes.description: After previously offending the Kreetassans, Enterprise attempts to make a better second impression, only to upset the alien race once again. A frustrated Captain Archer returns from the planet only to be further upset to find that his dog Porthos, has been affected by a pathogen native to the world. While Phlox works around the clock treating Porthos, Archer stands vigil in sickbay, experiencing first-hand the quirky everyday life of his Denobulan Doctor.

episodes.title: Marauders
episodes.description: Enterprise visits a colony with a deuterium trading post. But the people seem to be pretty unwilling to trade. Are they hiding something?

episodes.title: The Seventh
episodes.description: T'Pol asks Captain Archer to join her on a mission to capture a Vulcan fugitive that escaped her years ago.

episodes.title: The Communicator
episodes.description: Upon returning from covertly observing a pre-warp culture, Lieutenant Reed realizes he lost his communicator somewhere on the planet. Archer and Reed return to recover the lost technology, only to find the natives found it first. Captured and interrogated, the crewmen find themselves doing even more damage to the culture, who have scanned the prisoners and know them to be of another race. Meanwhile, Tucker and Mayweather try to figure out how to activate the cloak on the Suliban cell ship so they can mount a discreet rescue.

episodes.title: Singularity
episodes.description: T'Pol must save the ship after the crew becomes obsessed with trivialities during the approach to a black hole.

episodes.title: Vanishing Point
episodes.description: After Hoshi uses the transporter to avoid running into a storm, she starts to feel very strange.

episodes.title: Precious Cargo
episodes.description: While Trip is repairing a stasis pod at a Retellian cargo ship and the woman inside, heir apparent to the throne of Krios, wakes up, the ship makes a hasty departure. Trip must make a plan to escape.

episodes.title: The Catwalk
episodes.description: After receiving a warning about a radioactive storm approaching Enterprise, the crew is forced to take shelter in the ship's catwalk.

episodes.title: Dawn
episodes.description: Trip's shuttlepod is shot down by a hostile race and is forced to land on a deserted moon. There he must team up with the alien who shot him down in order to find a way back to Enterprise.

episodes.title: Stigma
episodes.description: T'Pol is diagnosed with a possibly fatal neurological disease as a result of a mind meld. Meanwhile, one of Phlox's wives visits Enterprise and becomes very interested in Trip.

episodes.title: Cease Fire
episodes.description: Captain Archer is asked to negotiate between the Andorians and Vulcans who are fighting over a small planet.

episodes.title: Future Tense
episodes.description: Enterprise discovers a pod with the body of a human that seems to be wanted by both Sulibans and Tholians.

episodes.title: Canamar
episodes.description: Archer and Trip are accused of smuggling and sent to the penal colony Canamar. While Enterprise manages to negotiate their release, a mutiny breaks out on the prison ship.

episodes.title: The Crossing
episodes.description: Enterprise is held captive by non-corporeal beings who claim to be explorers.

episodes.title: Judgment
episodes.description: After Enterprise lends aid to a group of accused rebels, Captain Archer faces a tribunal and charges of conspiring against the Klingon Empire.

episodes.title: Horizon
episodes.description: Mayweather temporarily leaves Enterprise to visit the cargo ship Horizon, where he was born and raised. Meanwhile, the Enterprise crew observes an unusual planetary event.

episodes.title: The Breach
episodes.description: At Dr. Phlox's request, Enterprise attempts to retrieve 3 Denobulan scientists from the planet Xantoras, where the Goverment has ordered all off-worlders to evacuate within 3 days. Tucker, Reed, and Mayweather navigate a series of labyrinthine underground caves in search of the scientists. Meanwhile, Enterprise lends assistance to a damaged ship fleeing the planet. Doctor Phlox faces an ethical dilemma when one of the refugees of the ship refuses life-saving treatment. The patient, an Antaran, holds a grudge against Phlox stemming from a war between their races that ended 300 years ago and would rather die than be treated by a Denobulan. Phlox defies Archer's direct order to force treatment because it goes against the Deobulan code to yield to "the will of the patient."

episodes.title: Cogenitor
episodes.description: Enterprise encounters a hyper-giant star. While there, they make first contact with the Vissians, a technologically sophisticated race with three genders. While making quick friends, and eagerly learning about the advanced technology, Trip gets curious about the Vissians third gender, known as the Cogenitor, who is crucial in the Vissian reproductive process. Against the wishes of the Vissians, Trip befriends the Cogenitor and encourages it to defy its cultural boundaries, which the Vissians are made aware of, and are angered by.

episodes.title: Regeneration
episodes.description: An Arctic research team makes a startling find: cybernetic creatures - Borg - buried in the ice. When the revived aliens seize control of a spacecraft, it's up to Archer to keep them from contacting the Collective and threatening Earth.

episodes.title: First Flight
episodes.description: After his close friend and colleague A.G. Robinson is killed in a mountain climbing accident, Captain Archer tells T'Pol about the Warp 2 test flight almost ten years earlier.

episodes.title: Bounty
episodes.description: After exploring an uninhabited planet, Captain Archer is taken prisoner by a Tellarite bounty hunter who was hired by the Klingons to return Archer to Qo'noS.

episodes.title: The Expanse
episodes.description: An alien probe launches a devastating attack on Earth. Archer, still being hunted by the Klingons, brings the Enterprise back home to investigate.

episodes.title: The Xindi
episodes.description: Enterprise has been in the Delphic Expanse for six weeks and have yet to get any intel about the Xindi. Strange anomalies affect the ship, sending cargo flying violently through the bays, pockets of atmosphere losing gravity and other incidents defying the known laws of physics. T'Pol helps Trip's insomnia with an intimate Vulcan therapy. Archer and Trip find another race of Xindi imprisoned in a mine.

episodes.title: Anomaly
episodes.description: After an attack by Osaarian pirates, Enterprise follows them to a mysterious sphere.

episodes.title: Extinction
episodes.description: Archer, Reed and Sato are transformed into aliens while visiting a planet.

episodes.title: Rajiin
episodes.description: Enterprise helps an alien woman, Rajiin, seeking to escape her life as a sex slave. Once on board she uses her alien abilities to gather biometric data about humans and is recaptured by her employers, the Xindi council.

episodes.title: Impulse
episodes.description: Enterprise answers a distress signal from a stranded Vulcan ship, only when arriving they find the ship completely desolate, wrecked - and filled with Vulcan zombies.

episodes.title: Exile
episodes.description: Hoshi Sato is contacted by a 400-year-old telepathic alien exiled on planet in the Expanse, shunned by his society because of his abilities. The alien offers to use his powers to help Enterprise find the Xindi and the weapon they are building, but only if Hoshi will stay with him while he works. She agrees to stay behind, while Enterprise confirms the Expanse has a second Sphere and is on its way to investigate.

episodes.title: The Shipment
episodes.description: Enterprise follows a lead and discovers a Xindi lab that refines Kemocite, the key ingredient in the weapon being built to destroy Earth. An away team of Archer, Reed and Hayes confront the lead researcher, Gralik Durr, who was employed by Degra to refine the Kemocite but was never told what it would be used for. When Gralik realizes it was his research that contributed to the 7 million deaths on Earth, he agrees to help Archer prevent further loss of life. Meanwhile, on Enterprise, Phlox and Tucker study the weapon they seized from the Xindi and find an organic component, a life-form serving as the rifle's power cell. Despite T'Pol's objection, Tucker tests the weapon.

episodes.title: Twilight
episodes.description: His memory crippled, Archer awakens years in the future, after the Xindi have reduced Earth to a cinder and the remnants of humanity have settled on a distant planet. Now, Archer learns that he may be the key to undoing this tragedy.

episodes.title: North Star
episodes.description: Enterprise investigates a previously unknown colony of humans who are living in the fashion of the American Old West. They are oppressing an alien race called the Skagarans.

episodes.title: Similitude
episodes.description: Archer decides to make a fast-growing clone of Trip to help save his life while Enterprise is stranded in a dangerous field with nucleonic particles.

episodes.title: Carpenter Street
episodes.description: Archer and T'Pol travel back in time to Detroit in 2004 to stop three Xindi-Reptilians from constructing a bioweapon.

episodes.title: Chosen Realm
episodes.description: Enterprise is taken over by religious zealots who want to use the ship in a war against heretics.

episodes.title: Proving Ground
episodes.description: Enterprise has found the location of the testing site of the Xindi weapon and gets some rather unexpected help.

episodes.title: Stratagem
episodes.description: Archer and the Xindi Degra are in a shuttle. With Degra suffering from memory loss, Archer tells him they escaped together from a prison and that the Insectoids took power after destroying Earth.

episodes.title: Harbinger
episodes.description: With Reed and Hayes fighting over a training program and Trip seemingly making T'Pol jealous, Enterprise discovers a dying alien in a pod with technology similar to the Spheres.

episodes.title: Doctor's Orders
episodes.description: While in command of Enterprise because the entire crew is in a coma, Dr. Phlox starts hearing some strange sounds.

episodes.title: Hatchery
episodes.description: Captain Archer orders the crew of Enterprise to save a Xindi-Insectoid hatchery.

episodes.title: Azati Prime
episodes.description: Archer decides he should pilot a kamikaze shuttle to destroy the Xindi weapon. Temporal agent Daniels urges him to reconsider.

episodes.title: Damage
episodes.description: Captain Archer has been returned to Enterprise by the Xindi council awaiting a hearing. But after a heavy attack by the Reptilians, Enterprise is stranded without a functional warp drive. They meet another ship in trouble because of space anomalies. The ship's captain isn't willing to trade in their warp coil and Archer must make a tough decision. Meanwhile T'Pol is having some strange sensations and can't control her emotions.

episodes.title: The Forgotten
episodes.description: As the crew continues to repair the ship and mourn the dead, Archer works to create trust and form a partnership with members of the Xindi council.

episodes.title: E²
episodes.description: Trying to pass through a subspace corridor, Enterprise is stopped by a version of itself from the future.

episodes.title: The Council
episodes.description: Enterprise has arrived at the location of the Xindi Council and with the help of Degra, Archer can make his plea in front of the five races of Xindi. Archer needs to prove that the Sphere Builders have been telling lies. While the Primates and Arboreals are already aware of the truth, convincing the other three races will not be easy. The Reptilians and Insectoids refuse to even listen to Archer. Meanwhile, the Sphere Builders haven't been sitting still, and have arranged a secret meeting with the Reptilians.

episodes.title: Countdown
episodes.description: While the Reptilians force Hoshi to decipher a launch code, the Primates, Arboreals and Archer think of a way to stop the Xindi weapon.

episodes.title: Zero Hour
episodes.description: Archer takes Degra's ship to try to prevent Earth from being destroyed and gets some unexpected help. Enterprise tries to destroy Sphere 41, but the Sphere Builders know about the plan.

episodes.title: Storm Front
episodes.description: Following the destruction of the Xindi weapon, the Enterprise crew discovers that they have been sent back in time to 1944. However, history has been altered, leaving Nazi Germany in control of a large portion of the eastern United States.

episodes.title: Storm Front, Part II
episodes.description: After Silik attacks Trip, Vosk wants to make a deal with Archer: supplies of the ship for the completion of his time machine in return for a trip to the 22nd Century.

episodes.title: Home
episodes.description: The crew take some time off. Archer meets an old friend, Captain Erika Hernandez. T'Pol takes Trip to Vulcan, with a surprise waiting. Phlox finds out Earth has become xenophobic.

episodes.title: Borderland
episodes.description: After a Klingon ship is attacked, it's discovered the imprisoned Dr. Soong's genetically enhanced humans are responsible. Archer takes him to prevent a war.

episodes.title: Cold Station 12
episodes.description: The Augments are on their way to Cold Station 12, where Augments embryos are kept.

episodes.title: The Augments
episodes.description: The Augments have yet again escaped. While Dr. Soong wants to hide the embryos, Malik has an entirely different and way more cruel plan.

episodes.title: The Forge
episodes.description: After a bombing destroyed the Earth embassy on Vulcan, a group known as the Syrrannites are suspected. T'Pol receives a map from her Syrrannite mother, leading into a dangerous desert, the Forge.

episodes.title: Awakening
episodes.description: T'Pol and Archer confront the Syrrannites and meet T'Pau who denies the embassy bombing. Archer, who has Surak's essence, is asked to help. V'Las threatens Enterprise to make sure an attack on the Syrrannites isn't witnessed.

episodes.title: Kir'Shara
episodes.description: While Enterprise travels to Andoria to warn them of the attack, Archer tries to bring the Kir'Shara to the High Command.

episodes.title: Daedalus
episodes.description: Dr. Emory Erickson comes aboard to supposedly conduct tests for subquantum transportation. However, he seems to have a different agenda.

episodes.title: Observer Effect
episodes.description: Noncorporeal aliens inhabit the bodies of Enterprise crew members to study how the crew reacts to a lethal virus infection that has afflicted Trip and Hoshi.

episodes.title: Babel One
episodes.description: Enterprise escorts Tellarites to peace talks with Andorians. While transporting they rescue Andorians and say the Tellarites attacked them. Enterprise is soon attacked by an Andorian ship, and Archer must prove who is responsible.

episodes.title: United
episodes.description: Captain Archer must convince Vulcans, Tellarites and Andorians to unite to find the Romulan ship.

episodes.title: The Aenar
episodes.description: Enterprise finds out the marauder was piloted telepathically by an Aenar, a subspecies from Andoria.

episodes.title: Affliction
episodes.description: While Enterprise is visiting Earth, Phlox is abducted by the Klingons and forced to research a cure for a virus destined to wipe out the race. Reed is tapped by a secret agency and ordered to betray Archer. Trip transfers to the Columbia.

episodes.title: Divergence
episodes.description: While Enterprise tries to bring Trip on board to reverse the malicious Klingon modifications, Phlox and Antaak find a cure for the virus that will not please General K'Vagh.

episodes.title: Bound
episodes.description: The men of Enterprise fall under the seductive control of three Orion women. Trip is the only male member of the crew not to succumb to the women.

episodes.title: In a Mirror, Darkly
episodes.description: Set in the dark and oppressive Mirror Universe, Commander Archer leads a mutiny in a bold attempt to seize control of an advanced starship - a vessel from the future that may be the key to saving the Terran Empire.

episodes.title: In a Mirror, Darkly, Part II
episodes.description: The Mirror Universe saga concludes as Archer declares himself captain of a formidable starship from the future, while his alien crew launch a rebellion in a desperate bid to keep him from achieving ultimate power.

episodes.title: Demons
episodes.description: While attending a conference on a proposed interplanetary alliance, Trip and T'Pol find out from a dying woman that they have a baby. Investigation shows the woman was a member of the xenophobic organization Terra Prime.

episodes.title: Terra Prime
episodes.description: Paxton threatens to destroy Starfleet Headquarters if all aliens don't leave Earth. Enterprise must shut down the verteron array on Mars, but it is extremely well defended.

episodes.title: These Are the Voyages...
episodes.description: In 2370, Commander William T. Riker is trying to clear his mind and relives the last mission of the first Enterprise on the holodeck.

show.title: Star Trek: Discovery
