show.description: Ten years before Kirk, Spock, and the Enterprise, the USS Discovery discovers new worlds and lifeforms as one Starfleet officer learns to understand all things alien.

episodes.title: The Vulcan Hello
episodes.description: While patrolling Federation space, the U.S.S. Shenzhou encounters an object of unknown origin, putting First Officer Michael Burnham to her greatest test yet.

episodes.title: Battle at the Binary Stars
episodes.description: Escaping from the brig while the ship is under attack, Burnham joins the captain in an audacious plan to end a battle rapidly escalating into war.

episodes.title: Context Is for Kings
episodes.description: Burnham finds herself aboard the U.S.S. Discovery, where she quickly realizes things are not as they seem, including the mysterious Captain Gabriel Lorca.

episodes.title: The Butcher's Knife Cares Not for the Lamb's Cry
episodes.description: With tensions and stakes high as Starfleet continues in their efforts to end the war with Klingons, Burnham begins to settle in to her new position aboard the U.S.S. Discovery.

episodes.title: Choose Your Pain
episodes.description: While on a mission, Lorca is captured by the Klingons and unexpectedly finds himself in the company of prisoner of war Starfleet Lieutenant Ash Tyler and notorious criminal Harry Mudd.

episodes.title: Lethe
episodes.description: The USS Discovery crew is intrigued by new addition, Lt. Ash Tyler. Sarek seeks Burnham's help, rekindling memories from her past. Admiral Cornwell questions Lorca's tactics.

episodes.title: Magic to Make the Sanest Man Go Mad
episodes.description: As the U.S.S. Discovery crew attempts to let loose at a party, an unwelcome visitor comes aboard bringing about a problematic and twisted sequence of events.

episodes.title: Si Vis Pacem, Para Bellum
episodes.description: The U.S.S. Discovery is tasked with a high priority mission to the planet Pahvo and learn the science behind the Klingons' cloaking technology.

episodes.title: Into the Forest I Go
episodes.description: Bypassing Starfleet's orders, Lorca uses the USS Discovery crew's ultimate asset, the ship itself, in an effort to end the war with the Klingons once and for all.

episodes.title: Despite Yourself
episodes.description: While in unfamiliar territory, the U.S.S. Discovery crew is forced to get creative in their next efforts to survive opposing and unprecedented forces and return home.

episodes.title: The Wolf Inside
episodes.description: As the crew continues their guise, Burnham undergoes a merciless mission in hopes of helping the U.S.S. Discovery return home. Tilly works on restoring Stamets' neurofunction.

episodes.title: Vaulting Ambition
episodes.description: Burnham heads to the ISS Charon with a special "gift" for the Emperor. With the help of an unexpected source, Stamets gains clarity while trapped inside the mycelial network. Saru asks for L'Rell's help.

episodes.title: What's Past Is Prologue
episodes.description: Lorca plans to move forward with a coup against the Emperor, propelling Burnham to make a quick decision to save not only herself, but the U.S.S. Discovery.

episodes.title: The War Without, the War Within
episodes.description: Burnham and the crew are faced with the harsh reality of the war during their absence. In order to move forward, Starfleet must use unconventional tactics and sources to take their next action against the Klingons.

episodes.title: Will You Take My Hand?
episodes.description: With Georgiou at the helm of the plan to end the Klingon war once and for all, the USS Discovery crew struggles to fathom and tolerate her hostile tactics. Memories of past hardships are rekindled within Burnham.

episodes.title: Brother
episodes.description: The crew of the U.S.S. Discovery joins forces with Captain Pike to unravel the mystery of seven mysterious red signals that have appeared across the universe.

episodes.title: New Eden
episodes.description: A new signal brings the Discovery to a distant planet, Terralysium, that is inhabited by the descendants of human survivors of World War III, which was fought on Earth 200 years earlier.

episodes.title: Point of Light
episodes.description: A surprise visitor to the U.S.S. Discovery brings shocking news about Spock and dredges up past regrets for Burnham. Following the asteroid incident, Tilly struggles to keep a grip on her reality. L'Rell's authority on Qo'noS is threatened.

episodes.title: An Obol for Charon
episodes.description: A mysterious sphere threatens the U.S.S. Discovery even as May, in her original form, implements a plan that puts Tilly's life in danger. Saru and Burnham's bond grows when Saru is forced to acknowledge a deeply unsettling Kelpien truth. Pike receives new intel on Spock from a loyal friend.

episodes.title: Saints of Imperfection
episodes.description: Burnham and the crew navigate a dangerous alien landscape in a race against time to save Tilly's life, but Stamets is not at all prepared for what they find in the process. Section 31 is assigned to help track down Spock, much to Pike's dismay.

episodes.title: The Sound of Thunder
episodes.description: When a new signal appears over Saru's home planet, Burnham, Saru and the crew embark on a perilous mission that puts Saru in danger and raises questions about the Red Angel's intentions. Hugh struggles to come to terms with his new reality.

episodes.title: Light and Shadows
episodes.description: Burnham goes to Vulcan in search of Spock, where she unearths surprising family secrets. In researching what is left of the Red Angel's signal over Kaminar, Pike and Tyler end up in battle with time itself. Georgiou has a few tricks up her sleeve for Leland and Section 31.

episodes.title: If Memory Serves
episodes.description: Spock and Burnham head to Talos IV, where the process of healing Spock forces the siblings to confront their troubled past. Stamets desperately tries to reconnect with an increasingly disconnected Hugh, while Tyler struggles to shed the crew's suspicions of him due to his past as Voq.

episodes.title: Project Daedalus
episodes.description: The Discovery crew infiltrates Section 31's headquarters and suspicions arise that the crew may have a traitor in their midst. Meanwhile, Burnham tries to help Spock, but her efforts don't go as planned.

episodes.title: The Red Angel
episodes.description: Burnham is stunned when she learns her ties to Section 31 run deeper than she ever fathomed. Armed with the identity of the Red Angel, the U.S.S. Discovery goes to work on its most critical mission to date.

episodes.title: Perpetual Infinity
episodes.description: Burnham receives the reunion she's been longing for, but it doesn't go quite as she imagined. Georgiou and Tyler sense a disturbing change in Leland.

episodes.title: Through the Valley of Shadows
episodes.description: A fourth signal leads the U.S.S. Discovery to an insular world, where Pike is forced to make a life-changing choice. Burnham and Spock investigate a Section 31 ship gone rogue, leading to a discovery with catastrophic consequences.

episodes.title: Such Sweet Sorrow
episodes.description: When the U.S.S. Discovery's crucial mission does not go according to plan, Burnham realizes what must ultimately be done. The crew prepares for the battle of a lifetime as Leland's Control ships get closer.

episodes.title: Such Sweet Sorrow, Part 2
episodes.description: The U.S.S. Discovery battles against Control in a fight not only for their lives but for the future, with a little help from some unexpected friends. Spock and Burnham discern vital new connections between the red signals while Burnham faces one of life's harshest truths: the right decisions are often the hardest to make.

episodes.title: That Hope Is You, Part 1
episodes.description: Arriving 930 years in the future, Burnham navigates a galaxy she no longer recognizes while searching for the rest of the U.S.S. Discovery crew.

episodes.title: Far from Home
episodes.description: After the U.S.S. Discovery crash-lands on a strange planet, the crew finds themselves racing against time to repair their ship. Meanwhile, Saru and Tilly embark on a perilous first-contact mission in hopes of finding Burnham.

episodes.title: People of Earth
episodes.description: Finally reunited, Burnham and the U.S.S. Discovery crew journey to Earth, eager to learn what happened to the Federation in their absence.

episodes.title: Forget Me Not
episodes.description: Burnham and Adira visit the Trill homeworld while Saru's efforts on the Discovery to help the crew reconnect yield surprises.

episodes.title: Die Trying
episodes.description: After reuniting with what remains of Starfleet and the Federation, the U.S.S. Discovery and its crew must prove that a 930 year old crew and starship are exactly what this new future needs.

episodes.title: Scavengers
episodes.description: After receiving a message from Book, Burnham and Georgiou embark on a rogue mission to find him, leaving Saru to pick up the pieces with Admiral Vance. Meanwhile, Stamets forms an unexpected bond with Adira.

episodes.title: Unification III
episodes.description: While grappling with the fallout of her recent actions, and what her future might hold, Burnham agrees to represent the Federation in an intense debate about the release of politically sensitive - but highly valuable - Burn data.

episodes.title: The Sanctuary
episodes.description: The U.S.S. Discovery crew travel to Book's home planet to help rescue it from Osyraa, the formidable leader of the Emerald Chain; Stamets and Adira continue their search for valuable information on the origin of the Burn.

episodes.title: Terra Firma, Part 1
episodes.description: The U.S.S. Discovery crew journey to a mysterious planet in hopes of finding a cure for Georgiou's deteriorating condition. Stamets and Adira make a stunning breakthrough with the newly acquired Burn data.

episodes.title: Terra Firma, Part 2
episodes.description: Georgiou uncovers the true depths of the plot against her, leading her to a revelation about how deeply her time on the U.S.S. Discovery truly changed her.

episodes.title: Su'Kal
episodes.description: Discovery ventures to the Verubin Nebula, where Burnham, Saru, and Culber make a shocking realization about the origin of the Burn as the rest of the crew faces an unexpected threat.

episodes.title: There Is a Tide...
episodes.description: After capturing the U.S.S. Discovery, Osyraa seeks a meeting with Admiral Vance while Burnham and the crew must overcome unimaginable odds as they attempt to regain command of their ship.

episodes.title: That Hope Is You, Part 2
episodes.description: As the Emerald Chain tightens its grip and the mystery of the Burn is finally solved, Burnham and the crew have one last chance to save themselves - and the Federation.

episodes.title: Kobayashi Maru
episodes.description: After months spent reconnecting the Federation with distant worlds, Captain Michael Burnham and the crew of the U.S.S. Discovery are sent to assist a damaged space station.

episodes.title: Anomaly
episodes.description: Saru returns to help the U.S.S. Discovery uncover the mystery of an unusually destructive new force; as Burnham leads the crew, she must also find a way to help Book cope with an unimaginable loss.

episodes.title: Choose to Live
episodes.description: Burnham and Tilly hunt the killer of a Starfleet officer as Stamets and the science team race against the clock to prevent the anomaly from killing anyone else.

episodes.title: All Is Possible
episodes.description: Tilly and Adira lead a team of Starfleet Academy cadets on a training mission that takes a dangerous turn. Meanwhile, Burnham is pulled into tense negotiations on Ni'Var.

episodes.title: The Examples
episodes.description: Burnham and Book race to evacuate a group of stranded colonists in the anomaly's path as one of the Federation's brightest scientists comes aboard the U.S.S. Discovery to do high-stakes research with Saru and Stamets.

episodes.title: Stormy Weather
episodes.description: Seeking answers, the U.S.S. Discovery ventures into a subspace rift created by the Dark Matter Anomaly. Meanwhile, Book faces a strange visitor from his past.

episodes.title: ...But to Connect
episodes.description: Tensions rise as representatives from across the galaxy gather to confront the threat of the Dark Matter Anomaly. Zora's new sentience raises difficult questions.

episodes.title: All In
episodes.description: Following a hunch, Captain Burnham tracks Book to an old haunt from their courier days and gets drawn into a high-stakes competition for a powerful weapon.

episodes.title: Rubicon
episodes.description: Captain Burnham and the U.S.S. Discovery race to stop Book and Ruon Tarka from launching a rogue plan that could inadvertently endanger the galaxy.

episodes.title: The Galactic Barrier
episodes.description: Captain Burnham and her crew must go where few have gone before: beyond the Galactic Barrier. Meanwhile, Book learns the truth of what drives Ruon Tarka.

episodes.title: Rosetta
episodes.description: While Captain Burnham leads an away mission to a planet that was once home to the aliens responsible for the DMA, Book and Tarka secretly infiltrate the U.S.S. Discovery.

episodes.title: Species Ten-C
episodes.description: As the DMA approaches Earth and Ni'Var, Captain Burnham and the crew of the U.S.S. Discovery attempt to make First Contact with the powerful species responsible before it's too late.

episodes.title: Coming Home
episodes.description: As the DMA approaches Earth and Ni'Var, and with evacuations underway, Burnham and the team aboard the U.S.S. Discovery must find a way to communicate and connect with a species far different from their own before time runs out.

episodes.title: Red Directive
episodes.description: Captain Burnham and U.S.S. Discovery are sent to retrieve a mysterious artifact hidden inside a 800-year-old Romulan vessel - but find that they're not the only ones on the hunt. Meanwhile, Saru is offered the position of a lifetime.

episodes.title: Under the Twin Moons
episodes.description: On Saru's last mission as Captain Burnham's Number One, the team ventures to a seemingly abandoned planet to hunt for what might be the greatest treasure in the galaxy.

episodes.title: Jinaal
episodes.description: On Trill, Captain Burnham, Book, and Culber must pass a dangerous test to prove themselves worthy of the next clue. Adira reconnects with Gray and Saru's first day as ambassador is complicated by his engagement to T'Rina.

episodes.title: Face the Strange
episodes.description: As the race between Discovery and the bounty hunters L'ak and Moll intensifies, an unexpected weapon forces Burnham and Rayner to work past their differences to save the rest of the crew.

episodes.title: Mirrors
episodes.description: Captain Burnham and Book journey into extradimensional space in search of the next clue to the location of the Progenitors' power, while Rayner navigates his first mission in command of the U. S. S. Discovery and Culber opens up to Tilly.

episodes.title: Whistlespeak
episodes.description: Captain Burnham must consider breaking the Prime Directive when a local tradition in a pre-warp society threatens Tilly's life. Culber tries to connect with Stamets and Adira steps up when Rayner assigns them a position on the bridge.

episodes.title: Erigah
episodes.description: With Moll and L'ak in custody, the Federation is pulled into a diplomatic and ethical firestorm when the Breen demand they be handed over. Meanwhile, Book looks for ways to help as Tilly, Adira and Reno work to decipher the latest clue.

episodes.title: Labyrinths
episodes.description: When Burnham is trapped within a "mindscape" designed to test her worthiness to retrieve the Progenitor's powerful technology, Book, Rayner and the crew of the U. S. S. Discovery must hold off the Breen long enough for her to escape.

episodes.title: Lagrange Point
episodes.description: After Moll and the Breen capture a mysterious structure that contains the Progenitors' power, Captain Burnham must lead a covert mission to retrieve it before the Breen figure out how to use it.

episodes.title: Life, Itself
episodes.description: Trapped inside a mysterious alien portal that defies familiar rules of time, space and gravity, Burnham must fight Moll - and the environment itself - in order to locate the Progenitors' technology and secure it for the Federation.

show.title: Star Trek: Short Treks
show.description: A series of stand-alone short stories that dive deeper into the key themes and characters from the expanding Star Trek universe.

episodes.title: Runaway
episodes.description: On board the U.S.S. Discovery, Ensign Tilly encounters an unexpected visitor in need of help. However, this unlikely pair may have more in common than meets the eye.

episodes.title: Calypso
episodes.description: After waking up in an unfamiliar sickbay, Craft finds himself on board a deserted ship, and his only companion and hope for survival is an A.I. computer interface.

episodes.title: The Brightest Star
episodes.description: Before he was the first Kelpien to join Starfleet, Saru lived a simple life on his home planet of Kaminar with his father and sister. Young Saru, full of ingenuity and a level of curiosity uncommon among his people, yearns to find out what lies beyond his village, leading him on an unexpected path.

episodes.title: The Escape Artist
episodes.description: Harry Mudd, back to his old tricks of stealing and double-dealing, finds himself in a precarious position aboard a hostile ship - just in time to try out his latest con.

episodes.title: Q&A
episodes.description: Ensign Spock's first day aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise doesn't go as planned when he and Number One are unexpectedly stuck together in a turbo lift.

episodes.title: The Trouble with Edward
episodes.description: Newly minted Captain Lynne Lucero is excited to take command of the U.S.S. Cabot. That is, until she meets Edward Larkin, an ornery scientist who believes he has found a revolutionary new use for tribbles.

episodes.title: Ask Not
episodes.description: When an attack on Starbase 28 leaves a surprise prisoner under Cadet Thira Sidhu's watch, she is faced with making a decision that may threaten her standing in Starfleet.

episodes.title: Ephraim and Dot
episodes.description: Ephraim, a humble tardigrade, is flying through the mycelial network when an unexpected encounter takes her on a bewildering adventure through space.

episodes.title: The Girl Who Made the Stars
episodes.description: When a lightning storm in space scares a young Michael Burnham, her father aims to ease her fears with a mythical story about a brave little girl who faced her own fears head on.

episodes.title: Children of Mars
episodes.description: 12-year-old classmates Kima and Lil find themselves at odds with each other on a day that will change their lives forever.

show.title: Star Trek: Picard
show.description: Follow-up to Star Trek: The Next Generation (1987) that centers on Jean-Luc Picard in the next chapter of his life.

episodes.title: Remembrance
episodes.description: Fourteen years after retiring from Starfleet, Jean-Luc Picard, still haunted by the death of Data, is living a quiet life on his family vineyard when a woman comes to him for help.

episodes.title: Maps and Legends
episodes.description: Without the support of Starfleet, Picard turns to Dr. Agnes Jurati and his estranged colleague Raffi Musiker for help in finding the truth about Dahj, unaware that hidden enemies are also interested in what he'll find.

episodes.title: The End Is the Beginning
episodes.description: After reflecting on the past with Raffi, Picard hires her partner, Cristobal Rios, to help him in his search for Bruce Maddox; Soji's work on the Borg cube catches the attention of the executive director.

episodes.title: Absolute Candor
episodes.description: On the way to Freecloud, Picard requests a stop at a Romulan refugee planet where he reunites with Elnor, the young Romulan he befriended fourteen years ago; Narek continues to learn more about Soji.

episodes.title: Stardust City Rag
episodes.description: The La Sirena crew reach Freecloud and find Bruce Maddox in a precarious situation, so Seven of Nine, the ex-Borg they recently picked up, lends her assistance.

episodes.title: The Impossible Box
episodes.description: Picard and the crew trace Soji to the Borg cube, forcing Picard to face memories of being Locutus; Narek believes he's found a way to safely exploit information from Soji.

episodes.title: Nepenthe
episodes.description: Picard and Soji, who's struggling to make sense of her recently unlocked memories, travel to a planet that happens to be the home of Picard's old friends Will Riker and Deanna Troi; Elnor and Hugh are left on the Borg cube to face Narissa.

episodes.title: Broken Pieces
episodes.description: Picard realizes how far some will go to protect secrets that go back generations when truths about the attack on Mars are revealed; Narissa orders her guards to capture Elnor, setting off a chain reaction on the Borg cube.

episodes.title: Et in Arcadia Ego, Part 1
episodes.description: With the Romulans in pursuit, Picard and the crew finally reach Soji's home planet - and discover more than they expected about the inhabitants.

episodes.title: Et in Arcadia Ego, Part 2
episodes.description: Picard and his team are pitted against the Romulans and the synthetics of Coppelius in a final confrontation.

episodes.title: The Star Gazer
episodes.description: Starfleet must once again call on legendary Jean-Luc Picard after members of his former crew - Cristóbal Rios, Seven of Nine, Raffi Musiker, and Dr. Agnes Jurati - discover an anomaly in space that threatens the galaxy.

episodes.title: Penance
episodes.description: Picard finds himself transported to an alternate timeline in the year 2400 where he must face one last trial orchestrated by his longtime nemesis Q.

episodes.title: Assimilation
episodes.description: Picard and the crew travel back to 2024 Los Angeles in search of the one person who can help them identify the point at which time diverged.

episodes.title: Watcher
episodes.description: With time running out to save the future, Picard seeks out an old friend for help; Rios winds up on the wrong side of the law; Jurati makes a deal with the Borg Queen.

episodes.title: Fly Me to the Moon
episodes.description: Picard discovers an important person from his past, Q continues his manipulation of the timeline, taking an interest in Dr. Adam Soong. Seven and Raffi attempt a daring rescue of Rios.

episodes.title: Two of One
episodes.description: Tallinn helps Picard and the crew infiltrate a gala on the eve of a joint space mission to protect an astronaut they believe is integral in restoring the timeline - Renee Picard; Kore makes a startling discovery about her father's work.

episodes.title: Monsters
episodes.description: Tallinn enters Picard's subconscious mind to help him wake from a coma and face his deepest fears; Seven and Raffi search for Jurati fearing she's succumbed to her inner monster; Rios struggles to hide the truth about himself from Teresa.

episodes.title: Mercy
episodes.description: With time running out before the launch of the Europa Mission, Picard and Guinan must free themselves from FBI custody. Seven and Raffi come face-to-face with Jurati and the horror of what she's become.

episodes.title: Hide and Seek
episodes.description: Picard must face the ghosts of his past when he and his crew are attacked by a new incarnation of an old enemy; Seven and Raffi face Jurati in a final showdown.

episodes.title: Farewell
episodes.description: With just hours until the Europa Launch, Picard and the crew find themselves in a race against time to save the future.

episodes.title: The Next Generation
episodes.description: After receiving a distress call from Beverly Crusher, Jean-Luc Picard enlists help from generations old and new for one last adventure: a mission that will change Starfleet and his old crew forever.

episodes.title: Disengage
episodes.description: Aided by crew of the U.S.S. Titan, Picard makes a discovery that will alter his life forever and puts him on a collision course with the most cunning enemy he's ever encountered.

episodes.title: Seventeen Seconds
episodes.description: Picard grapples with a life-altering revelation as the crew of the Titan attempt to outmaneuver Vadic, while Raffi and Worf uncover a plot by a vengeful enemy.

episodes.title: No Win Scenario
episodes.description: Picard, Riker and crew must confront the sins of their past as the Titan drifts helplessly in a mysterious space anomaly.

episodes.title: Imposters
episodes.description: Caught by Starfleet and facing court martial, paranoia grows as Picard struggles to uncover whether a prodigal crewman from his past has returned as an ally - or an enemy hellbent on destroying them all.

episodes.title: The Bounty
episodes.description: Now on the run, Picard and the skeleton crew of the USS Titan must break into Starfleet's most top secret facility to expose a plot that could destroy the Federation. Picard must turn to an old friend for help.

episodes.title: Dominion
episodes.description: Crippled, cornered, and out of options, Picard stages a gambit to trap Vadic and reveal her true motive - a gamble that puts the Titan in the crosshairs and forces Picard and Beverly to question every moral code they've ever held.

episodes.title: Surrender
episodes.description: Vadic forces Picard to make an impossible choice: deliver what he can never give - or watch his crew perish. Their only salvation lies in the mind of an old friend and old foe.

episodes.title: Võx
episodes.description: A devastating revelation about Jack alters the course of Picard's life - and uncovers a truth that threatens every soul in the Federation. Picard and his crew race to save the galaxy from annihilation - at a gut-wrenching cost.

episodes.title: The Last Generation
episodes.description: In a desperate last stand, Jean-Luc Picard and generations of crews both old and new fight together to save the galaxy from the greatest threat they've ever faced.

show.title: Star Trek: Lower Decks
show.description: The support crew serving on one of Starfleet's least important ships, the U.S.S. Cerritos, have to keep up with their duties, often while the ship is being rocked by a multitude of sci-fi anomalies.

episodes.title: Second Contact
episodes.description: Ensigns Mariner and Boimler run into difficulty on Galar. Meanwhile, an alien virus infects the crew of the Cerritos.

episodes.title: Envoys
episodes.description: After a high-profile mission goes awry, Boimler is further plagued with self-doubt when Mariner proves herself to be a more naturally talented sci-fi badass than he. Rutherford quits his job in engineering and explores other departments on the U.S.S. Cerritos.

episodes.title: Temporal Edict
episodes.description: A new work protocol eliminating "buffer time" has the Lower Decks crew running ragged as they try to keep up with their tightened schedules. Ensign Mariner and Commander Ransom's mutual lack of respect comes to a head during an away mission.

episodes.title: Moist Vessel
episodes.description: Captain Freeman seeks the ultimate payback after Mariner blatantly disrespects her in front of the crew. A well-meaning Tendi accidentally messes up a lieutenant's attempt at spiritual ascension and tries to make it right.

episodes.title: Cupid's Errant Arrow
episodes.description: Mariner is suspicious of Boimler's new girlfriend. Tendi and Rutherford grow jealous of a bigger starship's gear.

episodes.title: Terminal Provocations
episodes.description: The lovable but awkward Ensign Fletcher makes work difficult for Mariner and Boimler. Rutherford introduces Tendi to a holodeck training program that he created.

episodes.title: Much Ado About Boimler
episodes.description: Mariner tries to impress her best friend from Starfleet Academy who is now a visiting captain. Boimler is sent to a Starfleet medical ship after a transporter accident puts him "out of phase."

episodes.title: Veritas
episodes.description: Mariner, Boimler, Tendi, and Rutherford are caught off guard when aliens force them to testify about a series of seemingly unrelated events.

episodes.title: Crisis Point
episodes.description: Mariner repurposes Boimler's holodeck program to cast herself as the villain in a Lower Decks style movie.

episodes.title: No Small Parts
episodes.description: The USS Cerritos encounters a familiar enemy. Tendi helps a struggling recruit find her footing.

episodes.title: Strange Energies
episodes.description: The U.S.S. Cerritos is dispatched on a mission which results in an encounter with "strange energy."

episodes.title: Kayshon, His Eyes Open
episodes.description: Our Lower Deckers have trouble bonding with Ensign Jet Manhaver, who has been assigned Boimler's bunk and shift duties. Meanwhile, we get a glimpse of Boimler's life on the U.S.S. Titan, which is more intense than he thought it would be.

episodes.title: We'll Always Have Tom Paris
episodes.description: Assigned a special task by Dr. T'Ana, Tendi enlists Mariner for help. On the U.S.S. Cerritos, Rutherford is consumed by a bridge crew mystery.

episodes.title: Mugato, Gumato
episodes.description: The USS Cerritos is dispatched to a planet to investigate an unexplained sighting of a dangerous Mugato.

episodes.title: An Embarrassment of Dooplers
episodes.description: Mariner and Boimler try to track down the location of a legendary Starfleet party while the bridge crew deals with an insecure alien diplomat.

episodes.title: The Spy Humongous
episodes.description: Anomaly consolidation day on the U.S.S. Cerritos leaves the Lower Deckers with mixed emotions. Captain Freeman attempts to negotiate peace on the Pakled home world.

episodes.title: Where Pleasant Fountains Lie
episodes.description: Mariner & Boimler are stranded on an uninhabited planet with a sentient computer. On the Cerritos, Lt. Commander Billups must prove his engineering abilities to an old adversary.

episodes.title: I, Excretus
episodes.description: A consultant arrives on the U.S.S. Cerritos to run drills that require the lower deckers and bridge crew to swap duties.

episodes.title: Wej Duj
episodes.description: As the U.S.S. Cerritos crew has downtime during a long warp trip, a Klingon ship and a Vulcan one find themselves unknowingly heading to an encounter with the Starfleet ship.

episodes.title: First First Contact
episodes.description: The U.S.S. Cerritos is tasked to aid an Excelsior-class starship on a first contact mission.

episodes.title: Grounded
episodes.description: Mariner enlists her friends on a rogue mission to exonerate her mother as Captain Freeman faces a military tribunal for the destruction of Pakled Planet.

episodes.title: The Least Dangerous Game
episodes.description: On a tropical paradise planet, Mariner questions Commander Ransom on how he structures his away team. Boimler makes a bold career decision.

episodes.title: Mining the Mind's Mines
episodes.description: On a remote science outpost, stone orbs are bringing fantasies to life. Tendi starts her first day as a Senior Science Officer Trainee.

episodes.title: Room for Growth
episodes.description: Mariner, Boimler, and Tendi clash with their arch-rivals: Delta Shift. The Cerritos engineers go on mandatory relaxation leave.

episodes.title: Reflections
episodes.description: Mariner and Boimler work the Starfleet recruitment booth at an alien job fair, Rutherford challenges himself.

episodes.title: Hear All, Trust Nothing
episodes.description: The Cerritos crew unexpectedly spends a day on Deep Space 9.

episodes.title: A Mathematically Perfect Redemption
episodes.description: A wayward Starfleet ensign struggles to find a path to redemption.

episodes.title: Crisis Point 2: Paradoxus
episodes.description: Boimler's holodeck movie sequel tries to live up to the original.

episodes.title: Trusted Sources
episodes.description: A visiting reporter on the Cerritos puts Captain Freeman on edge.

episodes.title: The Stars at Night
episodes.description: The Cerritos crew must prove their worth in a mission race.

episodes.title: Twovix
episodes.description: The Cerritos ensigns must assist a caretaker on the voyage of a historically significant starship.

episodes.title: I Have No Bones Yet I Must Flee
episodes.description: Mariner tries to get demoted, Rutherford tries to get promoted, Boimler makes a big move.

episodes.title: In the Cradle of Vexilon
episodes.description: Boimler leads his first away mission on an alien megastructure.

episodes.title: Something Borrowed, Something Green
episodes.description: Tendi is summoned back to Orion for a wedding.

episodes.title: Empathological Fallacies
episodes.description: The hedonistic behavior of a Betazoid delegation is suspected of affecting the crew.

episodes.title: Parth Ferengi's Heart Place
episodes.description: The Cerritos visits the Ferengi homeworld.

episodes.title: A Few Badgeys More
episodes.description: Three computerized villains return to cause problems for the Cerritos crew.

episodes.title: Caves
episodes.description: The Lower Deckers go on a classic cave mission.

episodes.title: The Inner Fight
episodes.description: Captain Freeman assigns the Lower Deckers an overly safe mission to try and keep a self-destructive Mariner out of danger.

episodes.title: Old Friends, New Planets
episodes.description: Mariner finds herself held as the hoped-for ally of the disgraced Nick Locarno, now a megalomaniacal insurrectionist armed with a rebel fleet and a destructively planet-reforming Genesis device.

episodes.title: Dos Cerritos
episodes.description: A spatial anomaly forces the Cerritos crew to face their own faces.

episodes.title: Shades of Green
episodes.description: Tendi races to stop a conflict while Boimler and Mariner race to stop capitalists.

episodes.title: The Best Exotic Nanite Hotel
episodes.description: The Lower Deckers hunt nanites on a resort in space.

episodes.title: A Farewell to Farms
episodes.description: Dr. Migleemo cooks up some hot dishes. Mariner prefers hers served cold.

episodes.title: Starbase 80?!
episodes.description: Ransom uses too much disinfectant gel while Mariner gets paranoid about curses.

episodes.title: Of Gods and Angles
episodes.description: The Cerritos hosts peace talks between warring civilizations.

episodes.title: Fully Dilated
episodes.description: It's a pre-warp society undercover Girls Trip.

episodes.title: Upper Decks
episodes.description: The Lower Deckers have a pumpkin carving party.

episodes.title: Fissure Quest
episodes.description: Fissures must be closed before they get inflamed.

episodes.title: The New Next Generation
episodes.description: Season finale where lots of wild stuff happens.

show.title: Star Trek: Prodigy
show.description: A group of enslaved teenagers steal a derelict Starfleet vessel to escape and explore the galaxy.

episodes.title: Lost & Found, Part 1
episodes.description: The young alien Dal finds a hidden starfleet spaceship during an escape attempt from a mine planet. But who is still after the ship?

episodes.title: Lost & Found, Part 2
episodes.description: Dal needs a strong crew for the new ship if they want to leave Tars Lamora. But the Diviner and his daughter Gwyn have other plans.

episodes.title: Starstruck
episodes.description: Even with the guidance of their hologram advisor Janeway, the crew of The Protostar is tested when their ship is on a dangerous cosmic collision course.

episodes.title: Dream Catcher
episodes.description: The crew has their first away mission on an undiscovered planet that manifests their deepest desires, only to realize the planet has desires of its own.

episodes.title: Terror Firma
episodes.description: Marooned on a deadly planet, the crew must work together with their captive Gwyn to stay alive...except the planet isn't the only thing in pursuit.

episodes.title: Kobayashi
episodes.description: As Gwyn struggles to find her role aboard the USS Protostar, Dal tests his leadership skills in the newly discovered holodeck.

episodes.title: First Con-tact
episodes.description: When a mentor from Dal's past persuades him to use their Federation cover for personal gain, they quickly discover Starfleet has protocols for a reason.

episodes.title: Time Amok
episodes.description: When an anomaly fractures the U.S.S. Protostar in time, Hologram Janeway must synchronize the disjointed crew and save their ship before it destructs.

episodes.title: A Moral Star, Part 1
episodes.description: The crew forgo their dreams of Starfleet to return to Tars Lamora in a no-win scenario.

episodes.title: A Moral Star, Part 2
episodes.description: When their plan goes awry, the crew must improvise. Meanwhile, Gwyn discovers a dark truth that will forever jeopardize their quest toward salvation.

episodes.title: Asylum
episodes.description: At the edge of Federation space, the crew applies for asylum at a comm relay outpost, only for their starship to reveal its shocking true purpose.

episodes.title: Let Sleeping Borg Lie
episodes.description: When the crew encounters a dormant Borg Cube, Zero risks everything to save their ship.

episodes.title: All the World's a Stage
episodes.description: The crew answers a distress call to find a colony trapped in Starfleet's past.

episodes.title: Crossroads
episodes.description: When the crew attempts to secure transport to the Federation, they unwittingly cross paths with the Vice Admiral who is hunting them.

episodes.title: Masquerade
episodes.description: Trapped in the Neutral Zone, the crew encounters a rogue geneticist who sheds light on Dal's past.

episodes.title: Preludes
episodes.description: A Starfleet admiral digs into the past of the Protostar crew. Meanwhile, the Diviner recalls his life's mission.

episodes.title: Ghost in the Machine
episodes.description: When the crew gets trapped in the holodeck by a mysterious malfunction, they aren't sure what's programmed or what's real.

episodes.title: Mindwalk
episodes.description: Desperate to warn Starfleet of their dilemma, a daring experiment goes awry as Dal inadvertently swaps mind with a Starfleet Vice Admiral.

episodes.title: Supernova, Part 1
episodes.description: Surrounded by the Federation armada, the crew attempts to stop their ship from destroying all of Starfleet.

episodes.title: Supernova, Part 2
episodes.description: As the Federation hangs in the balance, the crew must make the ultimate sacrifice to save Starfleet's future.

episodes.title: Into the Breach: Part 1
episodes.description: Dal and his friends board Janeway's starship to investigate the wormhole created by the Protostar. Tired of his training, Dal longs for some action.

episodes.title: Into the Breach: Part 2
episodes.description: Gwyn runs into a familiar foe on the planet Solum. Janeway reveals the true stakes of their mission to Dal and his friends.

episodes.title: Who Saves the Saviors?
episodes.description: Traveling through the time rift, Dal and the crew search for Chakotay on Solum. With the support of her father, Gwyn challenges Ascencia.

episodes.title: Temporal Mechanics 101
episodes.description: Although separated by decades, the Infinity and the Voyager crews band together to save Gwyn's life. A mysterious messenger reaches out to Gwyn.

episodes.title: Observer's Paradox
episodes.description: Reunited on Voyager and under strict supervision, the gang must decode a secret message their mysterious benefactor left with Murf.

episodes.title: Imposter Syndrome
episodes.description: Hoping to hijack the Infinity before its scheduled destruction, Dal and the crew create hologram doubles to cover for their absence.

episodes.title: The Fast and the Curious
episodes.description: After using a Borg conduit to travel through time faster, Dal and his friends find themselves at the mercy of a demanding Kazon.

episodes.title: Is There in Beauty No Truth?
episodes.description: The crew detours to a colony of non-corporeal entities, who offer Zero an opportunity to obtain a physical body. Janeway discovers Dal's real intentions.

episodes.title: The Devourer of All Things: Part 1
episodes.description: Finally arriving at the coordinates, the Infinity crew discovers a hidden planet - and the long-awaited identity of their mysterious messenger.

episodes.title: The Devourer of All Things: Part 2
episodes.description: On the run from their time-erasing pursuers, the Infinity crew and their new ally search for an escape. Voyager embarks on a rescue mission.

episodes.title: Last Flight of the Protostar: Part 1
episodes.description: Thanks to Wesley Crusher's timely intervention, the cadets find the Protostar - but the ship's marooned guardian isn't eager for their assistance.

episodes.title: Last Flight of the Protostar: Part 2
episodes.description: Chakotay and the cadets devise a bold but perilous plan to relaunch the Protostar. Before the ship can fly, however, it will first have to sail.

episodes.title: A Tribble Called Quest
episodes.description: While harvesting bosonite on a barren world, the crew encounters aggressive, genetically-modified tribbles - and the Klingon scientist who created them.

episodes.title: Cracked Mirror
episodes.description: The Protostar's reunion with Voyager has unexpected side effects, bouncing the crew between alternate realities - including the Mirror Universe.

episodes.title: Ascension: Part 1
episodes.description: Just as the Protostar and Voyager crews bring their mission to a close, a former enemy suddenly resurfaces with surprising new powers.

episodes.title: Ascension: Part 2
episodes.description: Overwhelmed by Asencia's mysteriously advanced weaponry, the Protostar and Voyager crews take a series of calculated risks that endanger the cadets.

episodes.title: Brink
episodes.description: As war looms between the Federation and Solum, Gwyn proposes to lead the cadets on an undercover mission to gather intelligence and rescue Ilthuran.

episodes.title: Touch of Grey
episodes.description: Admiral Janeway devises a clever plan to liberate her crew from Asencia's prison, where they're trapped with an angry captive from the Loom.

episodes.title: Ouroboros: Part 1
episodes.description: A desperate Asencia launches an all-out attack on the Federation that will destroy subspace, while Wesley and the cadets try to correct the timeline.

episodes.title: Ouroboros: Part 2
episodes.description: The cadets fight Asencia in a battle for control of Solum and the future - but a sudden invasion by a destructive species complicates their end-game.

show.title: Star Trek: Strange New Worlds
show.description: A prequel to Star Trek (1966), this series follows the crew of the USS Enterprise under the command of Captain Christopher Pike.

episodes.title: Strange New Worlds
episodes.description: Captain Christopher Pike comes out of self-imposed exile to rescue an officer gone missing during a secret mission.

episodes.title: Children of the Comet
episodes.description: An ancient alien relic thwarts the Enterprise crew from re-routing a comet on track to strike an inhabited planet.

episodes.title: Ghosts of Illyria
episodes.description: Una must confront a secret she's been hiding when a contagion ravages the ship, incapacitating the rest of the crew.

episodes.title: Memento Mori
episodes.description: Pike must find unconventional Starfleet methods to deal with a malevolent force that attacks the Enterprise.

episodes.title: Spock Amok
episodes.description: A personal visit causes a comedy of errors during Spock & Pike's crucial negotiations with an unusual alien species.

episodes.title: Lift Us Where Suffering Cannot Reach
episodes.description: A threat to an idyllic planet reunites Captain Pike with the lost love of his life. To protect her and a scientific holy child from a conspiracy, Pike offers his help and is forced to face unresolved feelings of his past.

episodes.title: The Serene Squall
episodes.description: While on a dangerous humanitarian mission, the crew of the Enterprise stumbles into a harrowing game of leverage with the quadrant's deadliest space pirate.

episodes.title: The Elysian Kingdom
episodes.description: The USS Enterprise becomes stuck in a nebula that's home to an alien consciousness which traps the crew in a fairy tale.

episodes.title: All Those Who Wander
episodes.description: Enterprise crew comes face-to-face with their demons - and scary monsters too - when their landing party's stranded on a barren planet with a ravenous enemy.

episodes.title: A Quality of Mercy
episodes.description: In the season one finale, just as Captain Pike thinks he's figured out how to escape his fate, he's visited by his future self, who shows him the consequences of his actions.

episodes.title: The Broken Circle
episodes.description: A distress call from Lt. Noonien-Singh compels Spock to disobey orders and take the Enterprise and its crew into disputed space on a rescue mission.

episodes.title: Ad Astra Per Aspera
episodes.description: Commander Una Chin-Riley faces court martial, imprisonment and dishonorable discharge from Starfleet.

episodes.title: Tomorrow and Tomorrow and Tomorrow
episodes.description: La'an travels back in time to 21st-century Earth to prevent an attack which will alter humanity's future history.

episodes.title: Among the Lotus Eaters
episodes.description: Returning to a planet that dredges up tragic memories, Captain Pike and his landing party find themselves forgetting everything, including their own identities as he confronts a ghost from his past.

episodes.title: Charades
episodes.description: A shuttle accident leads to Spock's Vulcan DNA being removed by aliens, making him fully human and completely unprepared to face T'Pring's family during an important ceremonial dinner.

episodes.title: Lost in Translation
episodes.description: Uhura seems to be the only one who can hear a strange sound that seems to trigger terrifying hallucinations.

episodes.title: Those Old Scientists
episodes.description: An accident while investigating a time portal sends Ensigns Beckett Mariner and Bradward Boimler through time from the 24th Century, and Captain Pike and his crew must get them back where they belong before they can alter the timeline.

episodes.title: Under the Cloak of War
episodes.description: Captain Pike and his crew welcome a Klingon defector aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise, but his presence triggers the revelation of some shocking secrets.

episodes.title: Subspace Rhapsody
episodes.description: An accident with an experimental quantum probability field causes everyone on the Enterprise to break uncontrollably into song, but the real danger is that the field is expanding & beginning to impact other ships - allies & enemies alike.

episodes.title: Hegemony
episodes.description: When the Enterprise investigates an attack on a colony at the edge of Federation space, Captain Pike and the crew face the return of a formidable enemy.

episodes.title: Hegemony, Part II
episodes.description: Pike risks it all, taking the Enterprise on a daring rescue mission behind enemy lines, while the landing party attempts an escape from a deadly enemy.

episodes.title: Wedding Bell Blues
episodes.description: At a Federation celebration, an uninvited guest disrupts Spock and the crew's reflections.

episodes.title: Shuttle to Kenfori
episodes.description: In order to cure Batel, Pike and M'Benga travel to Klingon space, where M'Benga's past resurfaces on a dangerous planet.

episodes.title: A Space Adventure Hour
episodes.description: When La'An tests a prototype holodeck with a fictional case only she can solve, the consequences of failure get greater and greater, with the Enterprise hanging in the balance.

episodes.title: Through the Lens of Time
episodes.description: Chapel and Korby's quest leads the Enterprise to ancient ruins hiding a dark secret.

episodes.title: The Sehlat Who Ate Its Tail
episodes.description: Kirk's first day as captain turns disastrous when a scavenger ship seizes the Enterprise.

episodes.title: What Is Starfleet?
episodes.description: While aiding a war-torn planet, Pike and crew face scrutiny from a probing journalist.

episodes.title: Four-and-a-Half Vulcans
episodes.description: After a mission turns crew members into Vulcans, trouble arises when they try to revert to human.

episodes.title: Terrarium
episodes.description: Stranded on a toxic moon, Ortegas must defy her deepest beliefs to survive.

episodes.title: New Life and New Civilizations
episodes.description: When an ancient evil resurfaces, Pike faces a life-altering choice to stop it.
